j

ja 1.1

adj. (+abl) born (from); produced (by); made (of); caused (by) [√jan + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jāyati (+abl)
Meaning born (from); produced (by); made (of); caused (by)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym sambhava
Sanskrit ja
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

taṃ, bhikkhave, lobhapakataṃ kammaṃ lobhajaṃ lobhanidānaṃ lobhasamudayaṃ, taṃ kammaṃ akusalaṃ taṃ kammaṃ sāvajjaṃ taṃ kammaṃ dukkhavipākaṃ, taṃ kammaṃ kammasamudayāya saṃvattati, na taṃ kammaṃ kammanirodhāya saṃvattati.

AN 3.112 paṭhamanidānasuttaṃ

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, vedanākāyā, cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasampassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
ja 1.2

adj. (+abl) living (in); growing (in) [√jan + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jāyati (+abl)
Meaning living (in); growing (in)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ja
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

te hi pāraṃ gamissanti, chetvā jālaṃ'va ambujo, jhānāni upasampajja, appamattā raṇañ'jahā'ti.

SN 2.11 candimasasuttaṃ

yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jal'ambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ aṭṭhakavaggo 9
ja 2.1

letter. (gram) letter j; 16th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter j; 16th letter of the alphabet; palatal consonant
Sanskrit ja

Examples

464, 504. hassa jo.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 464

abbhāse vattamānassa hakārassa jo hoti. jahāti, juhvati, juhoti, jahāra.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 464
ja 2.2

ind. 8th item in a numerical list; lit. letter j ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning 8th item in a numerical list; lit. letter j
Sanskrit ja

Example

(ja) katamo eko dhammo uppādetabbo? akuppaṃ ñāṇaṃ. ayaṃ eko dhammo uppādetabbo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
ja 3.1

abbrev. abbreviation of Jātaka ✓

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of Jātaka
Sanskrit jātaka

Example

{cūḷava. 251; jā. 1.2.105 passitabbaṃ} virūpakkhehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ erāpathehi me,
chabyāputtehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ kaṇhāgotamakehi ca.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ
jagatippadesa

masc. place on earth; place in the world [jagatī + padesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning place on earth; place in the world
Construction jagatī + padesa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (jagatiyaṃ + padesa)
Sanskrit jagat + pradeśa

Example

na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjatī so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.

DHP 127 pāpavaggo
jagatiruha

masc. tree ✗
jagatī

fem. earth; world; lit. always going [√gam + a + tī] ✓

Grammar fem, intens
Meaning earth; world; lit. always going
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + gam + a > jagam (intens)
Construction jagam + tī
Derivative kita (tī)
Phonetic Change g > j
mt > t
Synonym jagant, paṭhavī, pathavī, puthavī
Sanskrit jagat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Example

na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjati so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.

DHP 127 kodhavaggo
jagatogadha

adj. immersed in the world ✗

Construction jagam + ant

Phonetic Change g > j
mt > t
Synonym jagatī, paṭhavī, pathavī, puthavī
Commentary (ANa) jagato gatī'ti lokassa nipphatti.
Sanskrit jagat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)
jaggati

pr. watches over, nourishes, lies awake [√jagg] ✗
jaggana 1

nt. keeping watch; staying alert; taking care [√jagg + ana] ~

Meaning keeping watch; staying alert; taking care
Root Family √jagg
Root √jagg･1 a (look after)
Construction √jagg + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit jāgaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ 1, 2 (wake)
jaggana 2

nt. tending, bringing up [√jagg] ✗
jagganaka

adj. looking after; watching over; tending [√jagg + ana + ka] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from jaggana
Meaning looking after; watching over; tending
Root Family √jagg
Root √jagg･1 a (look after)
Construction √jagg + ana + ka
jaggana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit jāgaraṇa +
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ 1, 2 (wake)
jagganā

fem. tending, bringing up, watchfulness [√jagg] ✗
jaggi

aor. watched over [√jagg] ✗
jaggitvā

abs. having watched over [√jagg] ✗
jagghati

pr. (+acc) laughs out loud [√jaggh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning laughs out loud
Root Family √jaggh
Root √jaggh･1 a (laugh)
Base √jaggh + a > jaggha
Construction jaggha + ti
Sanskrit ghagghati
Sanskrit Root √ghagh √ghaggh 1 (laugh)

Example

k'āyaṃ eḷagalāgumbe,
karoti ahuhāsiyaṃ,
na'y'idha naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā,
tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

JA 374 cūḷadhanuggaha jātakaṃ
jagghanā

fem. laughter [√jaggh] ✗
jagghi

aor. laughed, derided [√jaggh] ✗
jagghita

nt. laughter [√jaggh] ✗
jaghana

nt. lion, buttocks [√jaggh] ✗
jaghi

aor. laughed, derided [√jaggh] ✗
jaṅgama

adj. moving; going; walking; mobile [√gam + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from jaṅgamati, intens
Meaning moving; going; walking; mobile
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + gam + a > jaṅgama (intens)
Construction jaṅgama + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change g > j
m > ṅ
Synonym gāmī, cara, jaṅgala, tasa
Sanskrit jaṅgama
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici jaṅgamānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni, sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti, hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, yadidaṃ mahantattena

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

gāme vā yadi v'āraññe,
yattha passe bhujaṅgamaṃ.
daharo'ti n'āvajāneyya,
na naṃ paribhave naro.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
jaṅgamati

pr. goes; moves; walks [√gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intens of gacchati, intrans
Meaning goes; moves; walks
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + gam + a > jaṅgama (intens)
Construction jaṅgama + ti
Phonetic Change g > j
m > ṅ
Synonym gacchati
Sanskrit jaṅganti, jaṅgamīti, jaṅgamyate
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Examples

abbhāse vattamānassa kavaggassa cavaggo hoti. cikicchati, jigucchati, jighacchati, jigīsati, jaṅgamati, caṅkamati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 462

abbhāsassa ante niggahit'āgamo hoti vā. caṅkamati, cañcalati, jaṅgamati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? pivāsati, daddallati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 466
jaṅgala 1.1

nt. jungle ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning jungle
Notes see jaṅgala 2
English Cognate jungle
Sanskrit jaṅgala

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici jaṅgalānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni, sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti, hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, yadidaṃ mahantattena

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
jaṅgha

adj. with calves ✗
jaṅghaṭṭhika

nt. shin bone [jaṅghā + aṭṭhika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning shin bone
Construction jaṅghā + aṭṭhika
Compound kammadhāraya (jaṅghā + aṭṭhika)
Sanskrit jaṅghā + asthika

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni apagatasambandhāni disā vidisā vikkhittāni, aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena khandh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena hanuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena dant'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena sīsakaṭāhaṃ.

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
jaṅghapesanika 1

nt. taking messages by foot; running errands [jaṅgha + pesana + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning taking messages by foot; running errands
Construction jaṅgha + pesana + ika
jaṅghapesana + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (VINa) jaṅghapesanikenā'ti ettha jaṅghapesaniyan'ti gihīnaṃ dūteyyasāsanaharaṇakammaṃ vuccati, taṃ na kātabbaṃ.
Sanskrit jaṅghāpreṣaṇa (bsk)

Example

kuladūsako'ti kulāni dūseti pupphena vā phalena vā cuṇṇena vā mattikāya vā dantakaṭṭhena vā veḷuyā vā vejjikāya vā jaṅghapesanikena vā.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
jaṅghapesanika 2

masc. who carries messages ✗
jaṅghamagga

masc. foot-path ✗
jaṅghavihāranta

prp. walking; strolling; lit. living in the lower leg [jaṅghā + vihāranta] ~

Grammar prp of jaṅghāvihārati, comp vb, intrans
Meaning walking; strolling; lit. living in the lower leg
Construction jaṅghā + vihāranta
Variant jaṅghāvihāranta
Sanskrit jaṅghāvihārat
jaṅghā

fem. shin; calf; lower leg (from ankle to knee) ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning shin; calf; lower leg (from ankle to knee)
Notes from intensive of √gam jaṅgamati?
Sanskrit jaṅghā

Examples

aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena khandh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena hanuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena dant'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena sīsakaṭāhaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

dīghā jaṅghā yassa so'yaṃ dīghajaṅgho, kalyāṇabhariyo, pahūtapañño.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 331
jaṅghābala

nt. strength in one’s legs; lit. calf strength [jaṅghā + bala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning strength in one’s legs; lit. calf strength
Construction jaṅghā + bala
Compound kammadhāraya (jaṅghā + bala)
Variant jaṅghabala
Sanskrit jaṅghābala

Example

paccati munino bhattaṃ,
thokaṃ thokaṃ kule kule,
piṇḍikāya carissāmi,
atthi jaṅghābalaṃ mamā'ti.

TH 179 sāṭimattiyattheragāthā
jaṅghāvihāra

masc. walk ✗
jaṅghāvihāranta

prp. walking; strolling; lit. living in the lower leg [jaṅghā + vihāranta] ✓

Meaning walking; strolling; lit. living in the lower leg
Construction jaṅghā + vihāranta
Variant jaṅghavihāranta
Commentary (MNa) jaṅghāvihāran'ti jaṅghākilamathavinodan'atthaṃ jaṅghācāraṃ.
Sanskrit jaṅghāvihārat

Examples

atha kho hatthako āḷavako jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno addasa bhagavantaṃ gomagge siṃsapāvane paṇṇasanthare nisinnaṃ.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

daṇḍapāṇipi kho sakko jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami

jaṅgheyya

nt. knee-piece [jaṅghā] ✗
jaṅgheyyaka

nt. bottom section of a monk's robe (the portion which hangs by the shins) [jaṅghā] ✗
jacca

adj. of birth; by birth [√jan + ti + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jāti
Meaning of birth; by birth
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + ti + ya
jāti + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit jātya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

brahmajacco pure āsiṃ,
udicco ubhato ahu,
sojja putto sugatassa,
dhammarājassa satthuno.

TH 255 aṅgulimālattheragāthā
jaccandha 1

adj. blind from birth; birth-blind [jaccā + andha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning blind from birth; birth-blind
Construction jaccā + andha
Compound kammadhāraya (jaccā + andha)
Sanskrit jātyandha

Example

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, jacc'andho puriso, so na passeyya kaṇhasukkāni rūpāni, na passeyya nīlakāni rūpāni, na passeyya pītakāni rūpāni, na passeyya lohitakāni rūpāni

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
jaccandha 2

masc. man blind from birth; birth-blind person [jaccā + andha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning man blind from birth; birth-blind person
Construction jaccā + andha
Compound alutta tatiyā tappurisa (jaccā + andha)
Commentary (UDa) jaccandhā'ti jātiyā andhā, jātito paṭṭhāya acakkhukā.
Sanskrit jātyandha

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imissā'y'eva sāvatthiyā aññataro rājā ahosi. atha kho, bhikkhave, so rājā aññataraṃ purisaṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, yāvatakā sāvatthiyā jaccandhā te sabbe ekajjhaṃ sannipātehī'ti.

Examples

na jaṭāhi na gottena,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
yamhi saccañ'ca dhammo ca,
so sucī so ca brāhmaṇo.

na jaccā vasalo hoti,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
kammunā vasalo hoti,
kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo'ti.

uragavaggo 7

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
jaññajañña

nt. precious thing; cherished object; (comm) present for a new wife [jañña + jañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning precious thing; cherished object; (comm) present for a new wife
Construction jañña + jañña
Commentary (MNa) jaññajaññaṃ viyā'ti cokkhacokkhaṃ viya manāpamanāpaṃ viya. apica vadhukāpaṇṇākāraṃ viyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit janya + janya

Example

tam'enaṃ sāmikā ahikuṇapaṃ vā kukkurakuṇapaṃ vā manussakuṇapaṃ vā racayitvā aññissā kaṃsapātiyā paṭikujjitvā antarāpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ. tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kim'ev'idaṃ harīyati jaññajaññaṃ viyā'ti?

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
jaññā 1

ger. (+acc) knowing; understanding [√ñā + nā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of jānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning knowing; understanding
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + ya > jaññā
Phonetic Change nā > ya (Kacc 509, 516)
ñ > j
Synonym aññāya, jāniya, paññāya, viññāya
Commentary (THa) jaññā'ti jānitvā.
Sanskrit jñāya
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amuṃ āpānīyakaṃsaṃ piveyya yaṃ jaññā, im'āhaṃ pivitvā maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

sati kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
chasu phass'āyatanesu saṃvuto,
satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.

UD 25 mahāmoggallānasuttaṃ
jaññā 2

opt. (+acc) could know; must understand [√ñā + nā + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of jānāti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning could know; must understand
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + eyya
jāneyya > jaññā
Phonetic Change eyya > ā (Kacc 508, 515)
nā > ya (Kacc 509, 516)
ñ > j
Variant jāneyya
Sanskrit jñāyāt
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

attānañ'ce piyaṃ jaññā,
rakkheyya naṃ surakkhitaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ aññataraṃ yāmaṃ,
paṭijaggeyya paṇḍito.

DHP 157 attavaggo

sukhavinicchayaṃ jaññā, sukhavinicchayaṃ ñatvā ajjhattaṃ sukham'anuyuñjeyyā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
jaññū

imp. (+acc) know about!; understand! [√ñā + nā + tu] ~

Grammar imp 3rd sg and pl of jānāti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning know about!; understand!
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā > jaññā (irreg)
Construction jaññā + tu > jaññū
Phonetic Change ātu > ū
Commentary (ANa) mā maṃ jaññū'ti mā maṃ jānātu.
Sanskrit jānātu
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
jaṭa

nt. handle [√jaṭ + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from jaṭati
Meaning handle
Root Family √jaṭ
Root √jaṭ･1 a (twist, tangle)
Construction √jaṭ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym daṇḍaka
Sanskrit Root √jhaṭ 1 (become entangled)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ
jaṭaṇḍuva

nt. coil of dreadlocks; tangled roll of hair [jaṭa + aṇḍuva] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning coil of dreadlocks; tangled roll of hair
Construction jaṭa + aṇḍuva
jaṭaṇduva

nt. roll of twisted hair ✗
jaṭadharana

nt. wearing one's hair in twisted locks ✗
jaṭamissa

nt. twisted locks of hair ✗
jaṭā 1

fem. dreadlocks; matted hair [√jaṭ + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from jaṭati
Meaning dreadlocks; matted hair
Root Family √jaṭ
Root √jaṭ･1 a (twist, tangle)
Construction √jaṭ + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit jaṭā
Sanskrit Root √jhaṭ 1 (become entangled)

Examples

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

DHP 141 daṇḍavaggo

kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha,
kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ,
bāhiraṃ parimajjasi.

DHP 394 brāhmaṇavaggo
jaṭā 2

fem. tangle; mess; snarl; knot [√jaṭ + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from jaṭati
Meaning tangle; mess; snarl; knot
Root Family √jaṭ
Root √jaṭ･1 a (twist, tangle)
Construction √jaṭ + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (SNa) jaṭāya jaṭitā pajā yathā nāma veḷujaṭ'ādīhi veḷu'ādayo, evaṃ tāya taṇhājaṭāya sabbā'pi ayaṃ sattanikāyasaṅkhātā pajā jaṭitā vinaddhā, saṃsibbitā'ti attho.
Sanskrit jaṭā
Sanskrit Root √jhaṭ 1 (become entangled)

Example

antojaṭā bahijaṭā,
jaṭāya jaṭitā pajā,
taṃ taṃ gotama pucchāmi,
ko imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭan'ti.

SN 7.6 jaṭāsuttaṃ
jaṭādhara

masc. ascetic wearing matted hair ✗
jaṭādhāraṇa

nt. wearing dreadlocks; wearing matted hair [jaṭā + dhāraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning wearing dreadlocks; wearing matted hair
Construction jaṭā + dhāraṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jaṭaṃ + dhāraṇa)
Sanskrit jaṭā + dhāraṇa

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, jaṭilakassa jaṭādhāraṇamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

jana 1

Synonym jantu, nara, purisa, manussa
Sanskrit jana

Examples

panthasmiṃ vajantaṃ janaṃ,
hantvā kiñcikkham'ādeti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

uragavaggo 7

janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ,

janatā

fem. people; population; generation [√jan + a + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from jana
Meaning people; population; generation

Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)

Commentary (MNa) sā janatā'ti so janasamūho.
Sanskrit janatā
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

sele yathā pabbatam'uddhaniṭṭhito,
yathā'pi passe janataṃ samantato,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammamayaṃ sumedha,
pāsādam'āruyha samantacakkhu.

SN 6.1 brahmāyācanasuttaṃ

kiṃsū'dha bhītā janatā anekā,
maggo c'anek'āyatanappavutto,
pucchāmi taṃ gotama bhūripañña,
kismiṃ ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

SN 1.75 bhītāsuttaṃ
janana

adj. producing; creating; causing [√jan + ana] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāyati
Meaning producing; creating; causing
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym janaka, jananī, janika
Sanskrit janana
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

anatthajanano kodho,
kodho cittappakopano,
bhayam'antarato jātaṃ,
taṃ jano n'āvabujjhati.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
jananī 1

adj. producing; creating; causing [√jan + ana + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of janana
Meaning producing; creating; causing
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + ana + ī
janana + ī
Synonym janaka, janana, janika
Sanskrit jananī
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

kadā nu'haṃ bhayajananiṃ dukh'āvahaṃ,
taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
jananī 2

fem. mother; lit. creating [√jan + ana + ī] ~

Grammar fem, from janana
Meaning mother; lit. creating
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + ana + ī
janana + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Synonym ammā, mātar, māti, matti, mātu
Sanskrit jananī
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)
janapada

masc. country; province; land; area; location [jana + pada] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning country; province; land; area; location
Construction jana + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (jana + pada)
Synonym desa, padesa, bhūma
Sanskrit janapada

Examples

tena kho pana samayena bhagavā parito parito janapadesu paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅ'kate upapattīsu byākaroti

DN 18.1 janavasabhasuttaṃ

nānājanā janapadehi saṅgatā,
tava vīra vākyaṃ abhikaṅkhamānā,
tesaṃ tuvaṃ sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
janapadakathā

fem. talk about countries; discussion about lands [janapada + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about countries; discussion about lands
Construction janapada + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (janapadānaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit janapada + kathā

Example

gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ nagarakathaṃ janapadakathaṃ itthikathaṃ sūrakathaṃ visikhākathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṃ pubbapetakathaṃ nānattakathaṃ lok'akkhāyikaṃ samudd'akkhāyikaṃ itibhav'ābhavakathaṃ iti vā.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
janapadakalyāṇī

fem. beauty queen; beauty of the land [janapada + kalyāṇī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning beauty queen; beauty of the land
Construction janapada + kalyāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (janapada + kalyāṇī)
Sanskrit janapada + kalyāṇī

Examples

seyyathā'pi, poṭṭhapāda, puriso evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ yā imasmiṃ janapade janapadakalyāṇī, taṃ icchāmi taṃ kāmemī'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, janapadakalyāṇī, janapadakalyāṇī'ti kho, bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo sannipateyya.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
janapadakalyāṇīupamā

fem. simile of the beauty queen ✗
janapadakalyāṇīsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.20 (SN47.20) ✗
janapadacārikā

fem. walking tour of the country; journey around the land [janapada + cārikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning walking tour of the country; journey around the land
Construction janapada + cārikā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (janapadesu + cārikā)
Commentary (VINt) janapadacārikan'ti janapadesu caraṇaṃ, caraṇaṃ vā cāro, so eva cārikā, janapadesu cārikā janapadacārikā. taṃ pakkamanti, janapadagamanaṃ gacchantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit jānapada + cārikā

Example

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, vuttho me, bhante, sāvatthiyaṃ vass'āvāso. icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, janapadacārikaṃ pakkamitun'ti.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
janapadatudana

nt. hurt to the country ✗
janapadatthāvariya

nt. stability in the country; order in the land [janapada + thāvariya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning stability in the country; order in the land
Construction janapada + thāvariya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (janapade + thāvariya)
Commentary (MNa) janapadatthāvariyappatto'ti janapade thāvarabhāvaṃ dhuvabhāvaṃ patto
Sanskrit janapada + sthāvaratva

Example

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
janapadatthāvariyapatta

adj. who has achieved stability in the country, whose country is stable; whose position is secure ✗
janapadatthāvariyappatta

adj. who has achieved stability in the country; who has attained order in the land [janapada + thāvariya + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has achieved stability in the country; who has attained order in the land
Construction janapada + thāvariya + patta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (janapadatthāvariyaṃ + patta)
Commentary (MNa) janapadatthāvariyappatto'ti janapade thāvarabhāvaṃ dhuvabhāvaṃ patto
Sanskrit janapada + sthāvaratva + prāpta

Example

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
janapadanirutti

fem. language of the country; local language [janapada + nirutti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning language of the country; local language
Construction janapada + nirutti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (janapadassa + nirutti)
Sanskrit janapada + nirukti

Example

janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
janapadapadesa

masc. country district; rural district [janapada + padesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning country district; rural district
Construction janapada + padesa
Compound kammadhāraya (janapada + padesa)
Sanskrit janapada + pradeśa

Examples

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ bāhirā āpodhātu pakuppati. sā gāmam'pi vahati, nigamam'pi vahati, nagaram'pi vahati, janapadam'pi vahati, janapadapadesam'pi vahati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

pabbājeyyuṃ vā'ti gāmā vā nigamā vā nagarā vā janapadā vā janapadapadesā vā pabbājeyyuṃ

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

Meaning revered by a district
Construction janapada + pūjita
Commentary (VINa) gāmena pūjitaṃ gāmassa vā pūjitan'ti gāmapūjitaṃ. es'eva nayo sesapadesu'pi. apicettha janapado'ti ekassa rañño rajje ekeko koṭṭhāso.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in the country

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thoughts about countries; thinking about different lands
Construction janapada + vitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (janapada + vitakka)

Sanskrit janapada + vitarka

Example

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā ñātivitakko janapadavitakko anavaññattipaṭisaṃyutto vitakko

janamajjhe

ind. in the middle of a crowd; in the midst of people [jana + majjha + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, loc sg of janamajjha
Meaning in the middle of a crowd; in the midst of people
Construction jana + majjha + e
janamajjha + e
Commentary (THIa) janamajjhe'r'iva rupparūpakan'ti māyākārena mahājanamajjhe dassitaṃ rūpiyarūpasadisaṃ sāraṃ viya upaṭṭhahantaṃ, asāran'ti attho.
Sanskrit jana + madhye

Example

māyaṃ viya aggato kataṃ,
supinante'va suvaṇṇapādapaṃ,
upagacchasi andha rittakaṃ,
janamajjhe'r'iva rupparūpakaṃ.

janarahita

adj. devoid of people ✗
janalapanatthaṃ

ind. to butter people up; lit. for the sake of chatting people up [jana + lapana + attha + aṃ] ✓

diṭṭhā'pi sutā'pi te janā,
yesaṃ nāmam'idaṃ pavuccati,
nāmaṃ yev'āvasissati,
akkheyyaṃ petassa jantuno.

Meaning birth mother; real mother

janita

pp. generated, produced [√jan] ✗

janeta

masc. men; humans; human beings; people; lit. caused to be born [√jan + *e + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of janeti, caus
Meaning men; humans; human beings; people; lit. caused to be born
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 *e (be born, produce)
Base √jan + *e > jāne > jane (caus, irreg)
Construction jane + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym jana, janā
Commentary (MNa) janetasmin'ti janitasmiṃ, pajāyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit janayita
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ,
ye gottapaṭisārino,
vijjācaraṇasampanno,
so seṭṭho devamānuse'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ

janetar

masc. producer, generator [√jan] ✗
janeti

pr. (+acc) generates; produces; lit. causes to be born [√jan + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of jāyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning generates; produces; lit. causes to be born
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 *e (be born, produce)
Base √jan + *e > jāne > jane (caus, irreg)
Construction jane + ti
Synonym abhijāyati, āharati, uppādayati, uppādeti, nipphādeti, pasavati, pātukaroti, savati
Sanskrit janayati
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāvāyāmo.

DN 22.18 maggasaccaniddeso

taṇhā janeti purisaṃ,
cittam'assa vidhāvati,
satto saṃsāram'āpādi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayan'ti.

SN 1.55 paṭhamajanasuttaṃ
janetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to generate; to produce [√jan] ✗
janettī

fem. mother [√jan] ✗
janetvā

abs. (+acc) having produced; having generated; having caused [√jan + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of janeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having produced; having generated; having caused
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 *e (be born, produce)
Base √jan + *e > jāne > jane (caus, irreg)
Construction jane + tvā
Sanskrit janayitvā
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

sā taṃ sālaṃ anuparihareyya. sā taṃ sālaṃ anupariharitvā upari viṭabhiṃ kareyya. upari viṭabhiṃ karitvā oghanaṃ janeyya. oghanaṃ janetvā ye tassa sālassa mahantā mahantā khandhā te padāleyya.

Notes The following progression of meanings seems likely: machine room > torture chamber > sauna
Sanskrit yantragṛha
jantā

fem. machine; apparatus [√yā + nta + ā] ~

Grammar fem, from yāti
Meaning machine; apparatus
Root Family √yā
Root √yā･1 a (go)
Construction √yā + nta + ā
yanta > janta + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Phonetic Change y > j
Commentary (VINt) jantāghare'ti aggisālāyaṃ. sā hi jalati dibbati aggi etthā'ti jantā, janeti sarīrasedam'etthā'ti vā jantā, sā eva gharaṃ jantāgharan'ti vuccati, tasmiṃ.
Notes ABD takes it as jala + anta + ā. see jantāghara
Sanskrit yantra
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)
jantāghara

nt. steam room; sauna; lit. machine house [jantā + ghara] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning steam room; sauna; lit. machine house
Construction jantā + ghara
Synonym jantagga
Commentary (VINt) jantāghare'ti aggisālāyaṃ. sā hi jalati dibbati aggi etthā'ti jantā, janeti sarīrasedam'etthā'ti vā jantā, sā eva gharaṃ jantāgharan'ti vuccati, tasmiṃ.
Notes The following progression of meanings seems likely: machine room > torture chamber > sauna
Sanskrit yantragṛha
jantu 1

masc. man; person; being; lit. who is born [√jan + tu] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, irreg
Meaning man; person; being; lit. who is born
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + tu
Derivative kita (tu)
Synonym jana, nara, purisa, manussa
Commentary (PRS) jāyatī'ti jantu.
Sanskrit jantu
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

attadantassa posassa,
niccaṃ saññatacārino,
n'eva devo na gandhabbo,
na māro saha brahmunā,
jitaṃ apajitaṃ kayirā,
tathārūpassa jantuno.

DHP 104-105 sahassavaggo

tasmā jantu sadā sato,
kāmāni parivajjaye,
te pahāya tare oghaṃ,
nāvaṃ sitvā'va pāragū'ti.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
jantu 2

masc. name of a deity; lit. who is born [√jan + tu] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, irreg
Meaning name of a deity; lit. who is born
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + tu
Derivative kita (tu)
Commentary (SNa) jantū'ti evaṃnāmako devaputto.
Sanskrit jantu
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

atha kho jantu devaputto tadah'uposathe pannarase yena te bhikkhū ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi

SN 2.25 jantusuttaṃ
jantuka

masc. small being; little animal [√jan + tu + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, dimin of jantu
Meaning small being; little animal
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan + tu + ka
jantu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit jantuka
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

322, 359. tathā dvande pāṇi tūriya yogga sen'aṅga khudda jantuka vividhaviruddha visabhāg'atth'ādīnañ'ca.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
jantugāma

masc. name of a village; lit. people's village [jantu + gāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a village; lit. people's village
Construction jantu + gāma
Compound kammadhāraya (jantu + gāma)
Variant jatugāma, jattugāma
Commentary (UDa) jantugāman'ti evaṃ nāmakaṃ tass'eva vihārassa aparaṃ gocaragāmaṃ. jattugāman'ti'pi pāṭho.
Sanskrit jantu + grāma

Example

ekam'antaṃ ṭhito kho āyasmā meghiyo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, jantugāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisitun'ti. yassa dāni tvaṃ, meghiya, kālaṃ maññasī'ti.

AN 9.3 meghiyasuttaṃ
jantusutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 2.25 (SN2.25) ✗
japa

masc. muttering [√japp] ✗
japati 1

pr. recites; repeats a mantra; prays [√japp + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning recites; repeats a mantra; prays
Root Family √japp
Root √japp･1 a (mutter, pray)
Base √japp + a > jappa > japa (irreg)
Construction japa + ti
Commentary (SNa) japāmase'ti mayaṃ japāma sajjhāyāmā'ti ettaken'eva brāhmaṇ'amhā'ti maññamānā brāhmaṇā mayan'ti iminā gottena mattā hutvā visamaṃ caranti, visamāni kāyakamm'ādīni karontī'ti attho.
Sanskrit japati
Sanskrit Root √jap 1 (whisper)
japati 2

pr. utters, mumbles [√japp] ✗
japana

nt. mumbling, whispering [√japp] ✗
japā

fem. China-rose ✗
japi

aor. uttered, mumbled [√japp] ✗
japita

pp. uttered, mumbled [√japp] ✗
japitvā

abs. having uttered, having mumbled [√japp] ✗
jappa 1

masc. talk, speech [√japp] ✗
jappa 2

masc. idle talk, chatter [√japp] ✗
jappa 3

nt. whispering; muttered prayer or spell; recitation of the Vedas [√japp] ✗
jappati

pr. (+acc) desires; longs (for); yearns (for); hungers (for); lit. prays [√japp + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; longs (for); yearns (for); hungers (for); lit. prays
Root Family √japp
Root √japp･1 a (mutter, pray)
Base √japp + a > jappa
Construction jappa + ti
Synonym abhinandati, kāmeti, nikāmeti, pajappati, piheti
Sanskrit jap
Sanskrit Root √jap 1 (whisper)

Example

na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena,
sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā,
asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya,
santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
jappana 1

nt. wanting; desiring; lit. praying [√japp + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from jappati
Meaning wanting; desiring; lit. praying
Root Family √japp
Root √japp･1 a (mutter, pray)
Construction √japp + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit japana (praying)
Sanskrit Root √jap 1 (whisper)

Example

gedhaṃ brūmi mah'ogho'ti,
ājavaṃ brūmi jappanaṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ pakappanaṃ,
kāmapaṅko duraccayo.

aṭṭhakavaggo 15

Construction jambu > jambo + nadī + *a
jambunadī + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNa) jambonadan'ti mahājambusākhāya pavattanadiyaṃ nibbattaṃ, mahājambuphalarase vā pathaviyaṃ paviṭṭhe suvaṇṇ'aṅkurā uṭṭhahanti, tena suvaṇṇena kat'apiḷandhanan'ti'pi attho.

Examples

nikkhaṃ jambonadass'eva,
ko taṃ ninditum'arahati,
devā'pi naṃ pasaṃsanti,
brahmunā'pi pasaṃsito.

seyyathā'pi nāma nikkhaṃ jambonadaṃ dakkha-kammāraputta-ukkāmukha-sukusala-sampahaṭṭhaṃ paṇḍukambale nikkhittaṃ bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

nt. birth [√jan] ✗
jammi

Grammar adj
Meaning wretched; despicable; awful
Construction jamma + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Variant jamma
Commentary (SNa) dhī taṃ jammi jare atthū'ti lāmake jare dhī taṃ tuyhaṃ hotu, dhikkāro taṃ phusatu. (JAa) jammin'ti lāmikaṃ dandhaṃ.
Sanskrit jālma

Examples

yaṃ esā sahate jammī,
taṇhā loke visattikā,
sokā tassa pavaḍḍhanti,
abhivaṭṭhaṃ'va bīraṇaṃ.

DHP 335 taṇhāvaggo

dhī taṃ jammi jare atthu,
dubbaṇṇakaraṇī jare,
tāva manoramaṃ bimbaṃ,
jarāya abhimadditaṃ.

SN 48.41 jarādhammasuttaṃ
jaya 1

nt. victory; conquest; winning [√ji + *a] ✓

Meaning victory; conquest; winning
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 a (conquer)
Construction √ji > jay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym jita
Sanskrit jaya
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Examples

jayaṃ ve maññati bālo,
vācāya pharusaṃ bhaṇaṃ,
jayañ'c'ev'assa taṃ hoti,
yā titikkhā vijānato.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

jayaṃ veraṃ pasavati,
dukkhaṃ seti parājito,
upasanto sukhaṃ seti,
hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.

SN 20.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ
jara 2

masc. old age; growing old; decay [√jar + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from jarati
Meaning old age; growing old; decay
Root Family √jar
Root √jar･1 a (age)
Construction √jar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym jaras
Sanskrit jara
Sanskrit Root √jṛ √jṝ 1, 4, 6, 9, 10 (waste away)

Examples

ye kec'ime isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
kacci'ssu te bhagavā yaññapathe appamattā,
atāruṃ jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
kathaṃ nu dhīrā vitaranti oghaṃ,
jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
taṃ me muni sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
jara 3

masc. fever [√jar] ✗
jara 4

root. (gram) √jar (age) [√jar + a] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √jar (age)
Root Family √jar
Root √jar･1 a (age)
Construction √jar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit jvar
Sanskrit Root √jṛ √jṝ 1, 4, 6, 9, 10 (waste away)

Examples

505, 482. jara marānaṃ jīra jiyya miyyā vā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 505

jara mara'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ jīra jiyya miyy'ādesā honti vā. jīrati, jīranti, jiyyati, jiyyanti, miyyati, miyyanti, marati, maranti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 505
jaraggava

masc. old bull; old ox [jarā + gava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning old bull; old ox
Construction jarā + gava

Sanskrit jaradgava

Example

evam'etaṃ mahāvīra,
yathā samaṇa bhāsasi,
ettha c'eke visīdanti,
paṅkamhi'va jaraggavo.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
jaratā

fem. (abhidhamma) decay of materiality [√jar + a + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from jara
Meaning (abhidhamma) decay of materiality
Root Family √jar
Root √jar･1 a (age)
Construction √jar + a + tā
jara + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit jara +
Sanskrit Root √jṛ √jṝ 1, 4, 6, 9, 10 (waste away)
jarandhakāra

masc. darkness of old age; blindness of ageing [jarā + andhakāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning darkness of old age; blindness of ageing
Construction jarā + andhakāra
jaras

masc. old age; growing old; decay [√jar + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning old age; growing old; decay
Root Family √jar
Root √jar･1 a (age)
Construction √jar + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym jara
Sanskrit jaras
Sanskrit Root √jṛ √jṝ 1, 4, 6, 9, 10 (waste away)

Examples

taṇh'ādhipanne manuje pekkhamāno,
santāpajāte jarasā parete,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu taṇhaṃ apunabbhavāyā'ti.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,
oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati,
atha kho so jarasā'pi miyyati.

evaṃ ādittako loko,
jarāya maraṇena ca,
nīhareth'eva dānena,
dinnaṃ hoti sunīhataṃ.

jarādhamma

adj. liable to grow old; of the nature to decay; lit. old age nature [jarā + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning liable to grow old; of the nature to decay; lit. old age nature
Construction jarā + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (jarā + dhamma)
Commentary (MNa) jarādhammo'ti jīraṇasabhāvo. (ANa) jarādhamman'ti jarāsabhāvaṃ. esa nayo sabbattha.
Sanskrit jarādharma

Examples

jarādhammo'mhi, jaraṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

jarādhammaṃ mā jīrī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ

jarābhaya 2

nt. peril of old age; danger of ageing [jarā + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning peril of old age; danger of ageing

Commentary (ANa) tattha jarābhayan'ti jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjanakabhayaṃ. itaresu'pi es'eva nayo. vuttam'pi c'etaṃ, jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso. byādhiṃ paṭicca, maraṇaṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso'ti (vibha. 921).
jarāmaraṇa

nt. old age and death; ageing and dying [jarā + maraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning old age and death; ageing and dying
Construction jarā + maraṇa
Compound dvanda (jarā ca maraṇa ca)
Sanskrit jarāmṛtyu

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, jarāmaraṇaṃ? yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jarā jīraṇatā khaṇḍiccaṃ pāliccaṃ valittacatā āyuno saṃhāni indriyānaṃ paripāko, ayaṃ vuccati jarā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ bhikkhave etadahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti

SN 12.65 nagarasuttaṃ
jarāmaraṇanirodha

masc. ending of old age and death [jarāmaraṇa + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of old age and death
Construction jarāmaraṇa + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jarāmaraṇassa + nirodha)
Sanskrit jarāmṛtyu + nirodha

Example

siyā, āvuso. yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako jarāmaraṇañca pajānāti, jarāmaraṇasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, jarāmaraṇanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, jarāmaraṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

jarāmaraṇamanveti

pr. goes to old age and death; follows aging and dying [jarāmaraṇaṃ + anveti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning goes to old age and death; follows aging and dying
Construction jarāmaraṇaṃ + anveti
Commentary (UDa) yathā kiṃ? macchā'va kumināmukhe yathā nāma macchabandhakena oḍḍitassa kuminassa mukhe paviṭṭhā macchā tena baddhā hutvā maraṇam'anventi pāpuṇanti, evam'eva mārena oḍḍitena kāmaguṇabandhanena baddhā ime sattā jarāmaraṇam'anventi.
Sanskrit jarāmṛtyu + anvaiti

Example

kām'andhā jālasañchannā,
taṇhāchadanachāditā,
pamattabandhunā baddhā,
macchā'va kumināmukhe,
jarāmaraṇam'anventi,
vaccho khīrapako'va mātaran'ti.

SN 1.3 upanīyasuttaṃ
jala

nt. water [√jal + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning water
Root Family √jal
Root √jal×8 *e (hide, conceal)
Construction √jal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ambu, uda, udaka, oka, oda, odaka, ka, toya, daka, ninnaga, vāri, salila
Sanskrit jala
Sanskrit Root √jal 10 (cover up)

Examples

yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jala-ambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

ākhyātasāgaram'ath'ajjatanītaraṅgaṃ,
dhātujjalaṃ vikaraṇ'āgamakālamīnaṃ,
lop'ānubandh'ariyam'atthavibhāgatīraṃ,
dhīrā taranti kavino puthubuddhināvā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa
jalagocara 1

adj. living in the water, aquatic ✗

masc. fish ✗

masc. fish ✗
jalaja 1

jalaja 2

nt. lotus ✗
jalati

pr. burns; blazes; lit. shines [√jal + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning burns; blazes; lit. shines
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Base √jal + a > jala
Construction jala + ti
Synonym jhāyati, pajjalati
Sanskrit jvalati
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Example

seyyathā'pi, vaccha, aggi saupādāno jalati, no anupādāno, evam'eva khv'āhaṃ, vaccha, saupādānassa upapattiṃ paññāpemi, no anupādānassā'ti.

jalanta 1

prp. burning; blazing [√jal + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jalati, intrans
Meaning burning; blazing
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Base √jal + a > jala
Construction jala + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym jhāyanta, jhāyamāna, ḍahanta
Variant pajjalita
Sanskrit jvalat
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Example

siyā hi, bho gotama, jalantaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tv'eva bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
jalayati

pr. (+acc) kindles; lights; sets fire (to); causes to burn [√jal + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of jalati, trans (+acc)
Meaning kindles; lights; sets fire (to); causes to burn
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 *aya (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Base √jal + *aya > jālaya > jalaya (caus, irreg)
Construction jalaya + ti
Synonym samādahati
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)
jalayitvā

abs. (+acc) having kindled; having lit [√jal] ✗
jalādhāra

masc. deposit of water, reservoir ✗
jalābu

masc. womb; placenta ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning womb; placenta
Notes PED suggests √jar (age)
Sanskrit jarāyu

Example

catasso kho imā, sāriputta, yoniyo. katamā catasso? aṇḍajā yoni, jalābujā yoni, saṃsedajā yoni, opapātikā yoni.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
jalābuja

adj. womb-born; viviparous [jalābu + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning womb-born; viviparous
Construction jalābu + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (jalābumhā + ja)
Commentary (MNa) jalābumhi jātā jalābujā.
Sanskrit jarāyu + ja

Example

katamā ca, sāriputta, jalābujā yoni? ye kho te, sāriputta, sattā vatthikosaṃ abhinibbhijja jāyanti, ayaṃ vuccati, sāriputta, jalābujā yoni.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
jalābujadānūpakārasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 31.17–46 (SN31.17) ✗

Meaning viviparous reproduction; lit. born from womb
Construction jalābuja + yoni
jalābujādidānūpakārasuttatiṃsaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 30.17-46 (SN30.17-46) ✗
jalābujādidānūpakārasuttattiṃsaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 29.21-50 (SN29.21-50) ✗
jalālaya

masc. lake, artificial tank ✗
jalāsaya

masc. lake, artificial tank ✗
jali

aor. shone, burnt [√jal] ✗
jalita 1

pp. bright; shining; lit. shone [√jal + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of jalati
Meaning bright; shining; lit. shone
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Construction √jal + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym pabhassara, pāvaka
Variant pajjalita
Sanskrit jvalita
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Example

bhavanā abhinikkhamma,
addasaṃ lokanāyakaṃ,
indīvaraṃ'va jalitaṃ,
ādittaṃ'va hut'āsanaṃ.

APA 474 maṇipūjaka therāpadānaṃ
jalita 2

pp. burning; blazing; on fire; lit. blazed [√jal + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of jalati
Meaning burning; blazing; on fire; lit. blazed
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Construction √jal + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym āditta, ādittaka, jālī, pajjālita, paditta, sampajjalita
Variant pajjalita
Sanskrit jvalita
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Examples

mahāginī'va jalito,
anāhār'ūpasammati,
saṅkhāres'ūpasantesu,
nibbuto'ti pavuccati.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ

na ve aggi cetayati,
ahaṃ bālaṃ ḍahāmī'ti,
bālo ca jalitaṃ aggiṃ,
āsajja naṃ sa ḍayhati.

Phonetic Change g > j
ly > ll

Example

java 1

masc. speed; swiftness; quickness [√ju + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from javati
Meaning speed; swiftness; quickness
Root Family √ju
Root √ju･1 a (be fast)
Construction √ju > jav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Sanskrit java
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, javano puriso paramena javena samannāgato'ti alaṃ vacanāyā'ti?

javana 3

javanapañña

adj. with swift understanding; with quick intelligence; with fast wisdom [javana + paññā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with swift understanding; with quick intelligence; with fast wisdom
Construction javana + paññā + a
javanapaññā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (SNa) katamā javanapaññā? yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ atītānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ... yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ aniccato khippaṃ javatī'ti javanapaññā. dukkhato khippaṃ, anattato khippaṃ javatī'ti javanapaññā.
Sanskrit javana + prajña

Example

paṇḍito, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. mahāpañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. puthupañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. hāsapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. javanapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. tikkhapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
javanapaññatā

fem. state of fast wisdom; fact of having speedy understanding [javana + paññatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of fast wisdom; fact of having speedy understanding
Construction javana + paññatā
Commentary (PM) javanapaññatāya saṃvattantī'ti katamā javanapaññā? yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ aniccato khippaṃ javatī'ti, javanapaññā. dukkhato khippaṃ javatī'ti, javanapaññā. anattato khippaṃ javatī'ti, javanapaññā. yā kāci vedanā … yā kāci saññā… ye keci saṅkhārā… yaṃ kiñci viññāṇaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ viññāṇaṃ aniccato khippaṃ javatī'ti, javanapaññā.

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of java
Meaning quickly; speedily; swiftly; lit. with speed

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ
jaha 1

adj. leaving behind; giving up; abandoning [√hā + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jahati
Meaning leaving behind; giving up; abandoning
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jaha
Construction jaha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change h > j
Synonym paṭinissaggī
Sanskrit jaha
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Examples

okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ,
nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ,
kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ,
sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12

na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto,
attañ'jaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
jaha 2

imp. (+acc) give up!; leave!; abandon!; renounce! [√hā + a + a] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of jahatu, trans (+acc)
Meaning give up!; leave!; abandon!; renounce!
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jaha
Construction jaha + a
Phonetic Change h > j
Sanskrit jahāhi
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Examples

mayūrakoñc'ābhirutamhi kānane,
dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhato vasaṃ,
kāye apekkhaṃ jaha mā virādhaya,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

dukkhan'ti khandhe paṭipassa yoniso,
yato ca dukkhaṃ samudeti taṃ jaha,
idh'eva dukkhassa karohi antaṃ,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
jahati 1

pr. (+acc) gives up; leaves; abandons; deserts [√hā + a + ti] ✓

Meaning gives up; leaves; abandons; deserts
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jaha
Construction jaha + ti
Phonetic Change h > j
Synonym ujjahati, cajati, pajahati, paṭinissajjati, pariccajati, vippajahati
Variant jahāti
Sanskrit jahāti
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Examples

āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

disvāna rūpesu vihaññamāne,
ruppanti rūpesu janā pamattā,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu rūpaṃ apunabbhavāya.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
jahati 2

Phonetic Change h > j

Sanskrit jahāti
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Example

tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati. tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog'ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti, piyā vata maṃ kāmā jahissanti, piye c'āhaṃ kāme jahissāmī'ti.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
jahanta

prp. (+acc) giving up; leaving; abandoning; renouncing [√hā + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning giving up; leaving; abandoning; renouncing
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jaha
Construction jaha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change h > j
Synonym pajahanta, paṭinissajjanta, vijahanta
Sanskrit jahat
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Example

antaken'ādhipannassa,
jahato mānusaṃ bhavaṃ,
kiñ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
kiñ'ca ādāya gacchati,
kiñ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

SN 3.4 piyasuttaṃ
jahāti

pr. (+acc) gives up; leaves; abandons; deserts [√hā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning gives up; leaves; abandons; deserts
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jahā
Construction jahā + ti
Phonetic Change h > j
Synonym ujjahati, cajati, pajahati, paṭinissajjati, pariccajati, vippajahati
Variant jahati
Sanskrit jahāti
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Examples

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

abbhāse vattamānassa sarassa rasso hoti. dadhāti, jahāti.

jahita

cūḷavaggo 1

oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā

kodhaṃ jahe vippajaheyya mānaṃ,
saṃyojanaṃ sabbam'atikkameyya,
taṃ nāmarūpasmim'asajjamānaṃ,
akiñcanaṃ n'ānupatanti dukkhā.

DHP 221 kodhavaggo
jaḷa 1

adj. stupid; dull; dumb ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning stupid; dull; dumb
Antonym ajaḷa
Synonym manda, mudu
Sanskrit jaḍa

Example

paññāpāramitaṃ patto,
mahābuddhi mahāmati,
ajaḷo jaḷasamāno,
sadā carati nibbuto.

jaḷogī

fem. toddy; non-fermented juice of the palm ✗
jāgara

adj. awake; alert; lucid [√jāgar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāgarati
Meaning awake; alert; lucid
Root Family √jāgar
Root √jāgar･1 a (be awake, watchful)
Construction √jāgar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit jāgara
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ √gṛ 1, 2, 3 (wake)

Examples

sati lokasmi jāgaro,
gāvo kamme sajīvānaṃ,
sīt'assa iriyāpatho.

SN 1.80 pajjotasuttaṃ

pañca jāgarataṃ suttā,
pañca suttesu jāgarā,
pañcabhi rajam'ādeti,
pañcabhi parisujjhatī'ti.

SN 1.6 jāgarasuttaṃ
jāgarajātaka

nt. Jātaka 414 (JA 414) ✗
jāgaraṇa

nt. keeping awake [√jāgar] ✗
jāgarati

pr. is awake or watchful [√jāgar] ✗
jāgaranta

prp. awake; staying awake; alert; watchful; lucid; lit. being awake [√jāgar + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jāgarati, intrans
Meaning awake; staying awake; alert; watchful; lucid; lit. being awake
Root Family √jāgar
Root √jāgar･1 a (be awake, watchful)
Base √jāgar + a > jāgara
Construction jāgara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym jāgaramāna
Notes jāgarato is masc dat sg "for one who is awake"
Sanskrit jāgrat
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ √gṛ 1, 2, 3 (wake)

Examples

anavassutacittassa,
ananvāhatacetaso,
puññapāpapahīnassa,
n'atthi jāgarato bhayaṃ.

DHP 39 cittavaggo

dīghā jāgarato ratti,
dīghaṃ santassa yojanaṃ,
dīgho bālānaṃ saṃsāro,
saddhammaṃ avijānataṃ.

DHP 60 bālavaggo
jāgaramāna

prp. awake; staying awake; alert; watchful; lucid; lit. being awake [√jāgar + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of jāgarati, intrans
Meaning awake; staying awake; alert; watchful; lucid; lit. being awake
Root Family √jāgar
Root √jāgar･1 a (be awake, watchful)
Base √jāgar + a > jāgara
Construction jāgara + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym jāgaranta
Sanskrit jāgramāṇa
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ √gṛ 1, 2, 3 (wake)

Example

sadā jāgaramānānaṃ,
ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

DHP 226 kodhavaggo
jāgarasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.6 (SN1.6) ✗
jāgari

aor. awoke [√jāgar] ✗
jāgarijāṇuyoga

masc. vigilance, practice of watchfulness ✗
jāgarita

nt. being awake; lit. watched [√jāgar + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of jāgarati
Meaning being awake; lit. watched
Root Family √jāgar
Root √jāgar･1 a (be awake, watchful)
Construction √jāgar + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (MNa) jāgarite'ti jāgaraṇe.
Sanskrit jāgarita
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ √gṛ 1, 2, 3 (wake)

Example

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
jāgariya

nt. being awake; wakefulness; lucidity [√jāgar + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from jāgara
Meaning being awake; wakefulness; lucidity
Root Family √jāgar
Root √jāgar･1 a (be awake, watchful)
Construction √jāgar + iya
Derivative kita (iya)
Commentary (MNa) jāgariyam'anuyuttā'ti rattin'divaṃ cha koṭṭhāse katvā ekasmiṃ koṭṭhāse niddāya okāsaṃ datvā pañca koṭṭhāse jāgariyamhi yuttā payuttā.
Sanskrit jāgaryā
Sanskrit Root √jāgṛ √gṛ 1, 2, 3 (wake)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti, indriyesu guttadvāro hoti, bhojane mattaññū hoti, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto hoti.

AN 4.37 aparihāniyasuttaṃ

niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya,
jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī,
tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ,
methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Meaning devoted to the practice of wakefulness
Construction jāgariya + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
jāṇu

masc. knee ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning knee
Synonym jaṇṇuka, jāṇuka
Sanskrit jānu

Examples

evaṃ vutte ārāmadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udānesi.

AN 2.38 samacittavaggo

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yena te satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ nāmaṃ sāvesi

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
jāṇuka

masc. knee [jāṇu + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, from jāṇu
Meaning knee
Construction jāṇu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym jāṇu
Variant jaṇṇuka
Sanskrit jānu

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde aḍḍhaporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, kaṭimattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, jāṇukamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, gopphakamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

jāṇubandhanamukhabandhana

AN 2.38 samacittavaggo

parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetabbaṃ nābhimaṇḍalaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo
jāṇumatta

adj. knee-deep ✗
jāṇusoṇī

masc. name of a rich Brahman ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a rich Brahman
Variant jāṇussoṇi, jāṇussoṇī, jānussoni
jāṇussoṇi

masc. name of a rich Brahman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a rich Brahman
Variant jāṇusoṇī, jāṇussoṇī, jānussoni
Commentary (ANa) jāṇussoṇī'ti jāṇussoṇiṭhān'antaraṃ kira nām'ekaṃ ṭhān'antaraṃ, taṃ yena kulena laddhaṃ, taṃ jāṇussoṇikulan'ti vuccati. ayaṃ tasmiṃ kule jātattā rañño santike ca laddhajāṇussoṇisakkārattā jāṇussoṇī'ti vuccati.

Examples

tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetena vaḷavābhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāti divādivassa.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ

atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
jāṇussoṇibrāhmaṇasutta

masc. name of a rich Brahman ~

jāta 1

pp. (+loc or +abl) born; born (in); born (from) [√jan + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of jāyati (+loc or +abl)
Meaning born; born (in); born (from)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Antonym ajāta
Sanskrit jāta
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā assājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
jāta 2

pp. became; become [√jan + ta] ✓

Meaning became; become
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Antonym ajāta
Sanskrit jāta
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

yaṃ, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ jātaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, atthī'ti tassa saṅkhā, atthī'ti tassa samaññā, atthī'ti tassa paññatti, na tassa saṅkhā ahosī'ti, na tassa saṅkhā bhavissatī'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

tadā sāvatthiyaṃ satta manussakoṭiyo vasanti. tesu satthu dhammakathaṃ sutvā pañcakoṭimattā manussā ariyasāvakā jātā, dvekoṭimattā manussā puthujjanā.

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni pūtīni cuṇṇakajātāni

pañc'imāni, bhikkhave, bījajātāni. katamāni pañca? mūlabījaṃ, khandhabījaṃ, aggabījaṃ, phalubījaṃ, bījabījaññ'eva pañcamaṃ.

jātameva

Grammar sandhi, pp + ind
Meaning born that very day; born the same day

Example

tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
jātarūpa

nt. gold; lit. genuine matter [jāta + rūpa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning gold; lit. genuine matter
Construction jāta + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (jāta + rūpa)
Synonym kañcana, kanaka, satthuvaṇṇa, suvaṇṇa, sovaṇṇa, hāṭaka, hirañña, hema
Commentary (MNa) jātarūpan'ti suvaṇṇaṃ. (VIN 1.4.2.8) jātarūpaṃ nāma satthuvaṇṇo vuccati.
Sanskrit jātarūpa

Examples

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā. tam'enaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovak'antevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
jātarūpapaṭirūpaka

Construction jātarūpa + paripūra
jātarūpappatirūpaka

masc. fake gold [jātarūpa + patirūpaka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fake gold
Construction jātarūpa + patirūpaka
Commentary (SNa) jātarūpappatirūpakan'ti suvaṇṇarasavidhānaṃ ārakūṭamayaṃ suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ ābharaṇajātaṃ. chaṇakālesu hi manussā ābharaṇabhaṇḍakaṃ gaṇhissāmā'ti āpaṇaṃ gacchanti. atha ne āpaṇikā evaṃ vadanti, sace tumhe ābharaṇ'atthikā, imāni gaṇhatha. imāni hi ghanāni c'eva vaṇṇavantāni ca appagghāni cā'ti.
jātarūpamaya

adj. made of gold [jātarūpa + maya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, comp
Meaning made of gold
Construction jātarūpa + maya
jātarūparajata

nt. gold and money; lit. gold and silver [jātarūpa + rajata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning gold and money; lit. gold and silver
Construction jātarūpa + rajata
Compound dvanda (jātarūpa ca rajataṃ ca)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.8) jātarūpaṃ nāma satthuvaṇṇo vuccati. rajataṃ nāma kahāpaṇo lohamāsako dārumāsako jatumāsako ye vohāraṃ gacchanti. (MNa) jātarūparajatan'ti ettha pana jātarūpan'ti suvaṇṇaṃ. rajatan'ti yaṃkiñci vohār'ūpagaṃ lohamāsak'ādi.
Sanskrit jātarūpa + rajata

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu jātarūparajataṃ uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 18 rūpiyasikkhāpadaṃ

kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ jātarūparajataṃ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan'ti!

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ
jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇa

nt. accepting gold and silver; receiving gold and money [jātarūpa + rajata + paṭiggahaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning accepting gold and silver; receiving gold and money
Construction jātarūpa + rajata + paṭiggahaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātarūparajataṃ + paṭiggahaṇa)
Commentary (MNa) jātarūpan'ti suvaṇṇaṃ. rajatan'ti kahāpaṇo lohamāsako jatumāsako dārumāsako'ti ye vohāraṃ gacchanti, tassa ubhayassa'pi paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato, n'eva naṃ uggaṇhāti, na uggaṇhāpeti, na upanikkhittaṃ sādiyatī'ti attho
Sanskrit jātarūpa + rajata + pratigrahaṇa

Example

jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, āmakamaṃsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
jātarūparajatasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.83 (SN56.83) ✗
jātavaḍḍha

adj. born and raised (in); born and grew up (in) [jāta + vaḍḍha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born and raised (in); born and grew up (in)
Construction jāta + vaḍḍha
Variant jātavaddha
jātavaddha

adj. born and raised (in); born and grew up (in) [jāta + vaddha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born and raised (in); born and grew up (in)
Construction jāta + vaddha
Variant jātavaḍḍha
jātaveda

masc. fire ✗
jātavedas

masc. fire; lit. born property [jāta + vedas] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, mano group
Meaning fire; lit. born property
Construction jāta + vedas
Compound kammadhāraya (jāta + vedas)
Synonym aggi, joti, hutāsana
Variant jātaveda
Commentary (UDa) jalato jātavedaso'ti jhāyamānassa aggissa. anādare etaṃ sāmivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit jātavedas

Example

ayoghanahatass'eva,
jalato jātavedaso,
anupubb'ūpasantassa,
yathā na ñāyate gati.

UD80 dutiyadabbasuttaṃ
jātasaṃvaddha

adj. born and raised (in) ✗
jātasaṃvega

adj. arisen sense of urgency (towards) ✗
jātassara

masc. natural lake; naturally occurring pool [jāta + sara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning natural lake; naturally occurring pool
Construction jāta + sara
Compound kammadhāraya (jāta + sara)
Sanskrit jāta + saras

Example

ekassa paccekabuddhassa jātassaraṃ oruyha nhāyantassa tīre ṭhapitesu kāsāvesu cīvaraṃ thenetvā tesaṃ hatthīnaṃ gaman'āgamanamagge sattiṃ gahetvā sasīsaṃ pārupitvā nisīdati

DHPa 1.1.7 devadatta vatthu
jāti 1

fem. birth; rebirth; conception [√jan + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, irreg, from jāyati
Meaning birth; rebirth; conception
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Antonym maraṇa, ajāti
Synonym yoni
Sanskrit jāti
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

ye kec'ime isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
kacci'ssu te bhagavā yaññapathe appamattā,
atāruṃ jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
jāti 2

fem. class; caste; social status; lit. birth [√jan + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, irreg, from jāyati
Meaning class; caste; social status; lit. birth
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Sanskrit jāti
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

devayānaṃ abhiruyha,
virajaṃ so mahāpathaṃ,
kāmarāgaṃ virājetvā,
brahmalok'ūpago ahu,
na naṃ jāti nivāresi,
brahmalok'ūpapattiyā.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
jāti 3

fem. age; years; lit. birth [√jan + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, irreg, from jāyati
Meaning age; years; lit. birth
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Sanskrit jāti
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

tena kho pana samayena brahmāyu brāhmaṇo mithilāyaṃ paṭivasati jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, vīsavassasatiko jātiyā, tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāragū

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

kiṃ pana me samaṇo gotamo ime pañhe puṭṭho byākarissati! samaṇo hi gotamo daharo c'eva jātiyā, navo ca pabbajjāyā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
jāti 4

fem. sort of, kind of [√jan] ✗
jātika 1

adj. of nature; of type; of class; of category; lit. of birth [√jan + ti + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jāti
Meaning of nature; of type; of class; of category; lit. of birth
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti + ka
jāti + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Sanskrit jātīya, jātika (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātikā bhavissāmā'ti

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañ'ca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañ'ca dhammānaṃ atth'ūpaparikkhī hoti attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya, dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ
jātika 2

adj. descended from; born from; produced by; lit. of birth [√jan + ti + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jāti
Meaning descended from; born from; produced by; lit. of birth
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti + ka
jāti + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Commentary (MNa) kā jāti etesan'ti kiṃjātikā
Sanskrit jātīya, jātika (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
jātika 3

adj. belonging to clan, or nation of [√jan] ✗
jātikulaputta

masc. good man by birth [jāti + kulaputta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning good man by birth
Construction jāti + kulaputta
jātikosa

masc. mace (of nutmeg) ✗
jātikkhaya

masc. extinction of birth; wearing away of rebirth [jāti + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning extinction of birth; wearing away of rebirth
Construction jāti + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jātiyā + khaya)
Variant jātikhaya
Sanskrit jāti + kṣaya

Examples

tasmā upādānakkhayā,
samma'd'aññāya paṇḍitā,
jātikkhayaṃ abhiññāya,
na gacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedi,
sagg'āpāyañ'ca passati,
atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
abhiññā vosito muni.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
jātikkhayamabhiññāya

ger. directly knowing the destruction of birth; understanding the wearing away of rebirth experientially [jātikkhayaṃ + abhiññāya] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning directly knowing the destruction of birth; understanding the wearing away of rebirth experientially
Construction jātikkhayaṃ + abhiññāya
Sanskrit jāti + kṣaya + abhijñā, abhijñīya

Example

ariyaddasā vedaguno,
samma'd'aññāya paṇḍitā,
jātikkhayam'abhiññāya,
n'āgacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

ITI93 aggisuttaṃ
jātikkhetta

nt. birth-place, realm of rebirth ✗
jātikhaya

masc. extinction of birth; wearing away of rebirth [jāti + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning extinction of birth; wearing away of rebirth
Construction jāti + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jātiyā + khaya)
Variant jātikkhaya
Sanskrit jāti + kṣaya

Example

kappāni viceyya kevalāni,
saṃsāraṃ dubhayaṃ cut'ūpapātaṃ,
vigatarajam'anaṅgaṇaṃ visuddhaṃ,
pattaṃ jātikhayaṃ tam'āhu buddhan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
jātikhayantadassī

adj. who sees the wearing away and ending of birth; who observes the exhaustion and cessation of rebirth [jāti + khayanta + dassī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who sees the wearing away and ending of birth; who observes the exhaustion and cessation of rebirth
Construction jāti + khayanta + dassī
Variant jātikkhayantadassī
Commentary (SNa) jātikkhayantadassī'ti jātiyā khayo'ti ca anto'ti ca nibbānaṃ, taṃ passatī'ti attho.
jātikhayāntadassī

adj. seeing the destruction of (re-) birth, or, seeing the destruction of birth and death ✗
jātijarā

fem. birth and old age; being born and ageing [jāti + jarā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning birth and old age; being born and ageing
Construction jāti + jarā
Compound dvanda (jāti ca jarā ca)
Variant jātijjarā
Sanskrit jāti + jarā

Examples

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

DHP 238 malavaggo

saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paroparāni,
yass'iñjitaṃ n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaran'ti brūmī'ti.

AN 4.41 samādhibhāvanāsuttaṃ
jātijarāgahaṇa

nt. employing the phrase "birth and old age" ✗
jātijarābyādhimaraṇa

nt. birth, old age, sickness and death [jāti + jarā + byādhi + maraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning birth, old age, sickness and death
Construction jāti + jarā + byādhi + maraṇa
jātijarābhibhūta

adj. overpowered by birth and old age; overwhelmed by being born and ageing [jātijarā + abhibhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overpowered by birth and old age; overwhelmed by being born and ageing
Construction jātijarā + abhibhūta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jātijarāya + abhibhūta)
Sanskrit jātijjarā + abhibhūta

Example

sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
yathā'pi passe janataṃ samantato,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammamayaṃ sumedho,
pāsādam'āruyha samantacakkhu,
sok'āvatiṇṇaṃ janatam'apetasoko,
avekkhati jātijar'ābhibhūtan'ti.

ITI 38 vitakkasuttaṃ
jātijarāmaraṇa

nt. birth, old age and death; being born, ageing and dying [jāti + jarā + maraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning birth, old age and death; being born, ageing and dying
Construction jāti + jarā + maraṇa
Compound dvanda (jāti ca jarā ca maraṇa)
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + maraṇa

Example

yattha atthi āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti, atthi tattha āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇaṃ. yattha atthi āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇaṃ, sasokaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, sadaraṃ saupāyāsan'ti vadāmi.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ
jātijarāmaraṇadukkhasamudayasambhava

masc. generation of the arising of birth, old age, death and suffering ✗
jātijarāmaraṇanibbattaka

adj. generating birth, old age and death ✗
jātijarāmaraṇika

adj. leading to birth old age and death; lit. related to birth old age and death [jāti + jarā + maraṇa + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from jātijarāmaraṇa
Meaning leading to birth old age and death; lit. related to birth old age and death
Construction jāti + jarā + maraṇa + ika
jātijarāmaraṇa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Variant jātijarāmaraṇiya
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + maraṇīya

Examples

iti kāmayogo bhavayogo diṭṭhiyogo avijjāyogo, saṃyutto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi saṃkilesikehi ponobhavikehi sadarehi dukkhavipākehi āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇikehi.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ

yāni kho pana tāni pubbe attanā katāni pāpakāni kammāni saṃkilesikāni ponobhavikāni sadarāni dukkhavipākāni āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇikāni, tesaṃ vipāko mā nibbattī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ.

AN 4.182 pāṭibhogasuttaṃ
jātijarāmaraṇiya

adj. leading to birth old age and death [jāti + jarā + maraṇa + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from jātijarāmaraṇa
Meaning leading to birth old age and death
Construction jāti + jarā + maraṇa + iya
jātijarāmaraṇa + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Variant jātijarāmaraṇika
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + maraṇīya

Examples

bāhit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

tathāgatassa, pāpima, ye āsavā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā, te pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
jātijarūpaga

adj. headed to birth and old age; undergoing birth and old age; experiencing birth and old age [jāti + jarā + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning headed to birth and old age; undergoing birth and old age; experiencing birth and old age
Construction jāti + jarā + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātijaraṃ + upaga)
Commentary (SNPa) jātijarūpagā'ti jātijaraṃ upagatā, jātijarāya vā upagatā, na parimuccanti jātijarāyā'ti evaṃ veditabbā.
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + upaga

Examples

cetovimuttihīnā te,
atho paññāvimuttiyā,
abhabbā te antakiriyāya,
te ve jātijar'ūpagā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

saritāni sinehitāni ca,
somanassāni bhavanti jantuno,
te sātasitā sukh'esino,
te ve jātijar'ūpagā narā.

DHP 341 taṇhāvaggo
jātijarūpagāmī

adj. headed towards birth and old age; experiencing birth and old age [jāti + jarā + upagāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning headed towards birth and old age; experiencing birth and old age
Construction jāti + jarā + upagāmī
Phonetic Change with metrically shortened i
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātijaraṃ + upagāmī)
Variant jātijarūpagāhī, jātijarūpaga
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + upagāmin

Example

ye keci kāmesu asaññatā janā,
avītarāgā idha kāmabhogino,
punappunaṃ jātijar'ūpagāmi te,
taṇh'ādhipannā anusotagāmino.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ
jātijarūpagāhī

adj. grasping birth and old age [jātijarā + upagāhī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning grasping birth and old age
Construction jātijarā + upagāhī
Variant jātijarūpagāmī, jātijarūpaga
jātijarūpeta

adj. immersed in birth and old age; suffering birth and aging; lit. approached birth and old age [jātijarā + upeta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in birth and old age; suffering birth and aging; lit. approached birth and old age
Construction jātijarā + upeta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātijaraṃ + upeta)
Sanskrit jāti + jarā + upeta

Example

so imaṃ palipathaṃ duggaṃ,
atikkamma tathāvidho,
pajaṃ jātijar'ūpetaṃ,
phandamānaṃ avekkhatī'ti.

AN 8.56 bhayasuttaṃ
jātijātika

adj. born from birth; produced by conception [jāti + jātika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from birth; produced by conception
Construction jāti + jātika
jātijāramaṇīya

adj. producing (further) birth, old age and death ✗
jātijārūpaga

adj. undergoing birth, old age, and death; subject to birth, old age, and death ✗
jātijārūpagāmī

adj. undergoing birth, old age, and death ✗
jātitthaddha

adj. proud of one’s birth [jāti + thaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning proud of one’s birth
Construction jāti + thaddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jātiyā + thaddha)
Commentary (SNPa) jātitthaddho nāma yo, ahaṃ jātisampanno'ti mānaṃ janetvā tena thaddho vātapūritabhastā viya uddhumāto hutvā na kassaci onamati. esa nayo dhanagottatthaddhesu.
Sanskrit jāti + stabdha

Example

jātitthaddho dhanatthaddho,
gottatthaddho ca yo naro,
saññātiṃ atimaññeti,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
jātithera

masc. senior according to age; lit. birth elder [jāti + thera] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning senior according to age; lit. birth elder
Construction jāti + thera
jātidhamma

adj. liable to birth; of the nature to be born; lit. birth nature [jāti + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning liable to birth; of the nature to be born; lit. birth nature
Construction jāti + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (jāti + dhamma)
Commentary (MNa) jātidhammo'ti jāyanasabhāvo.
Sanskrit jātidharma (caste)

Examples

kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, jātidhammaṃ vadetha? puttabhariyaṃ, bhikkhave, jātidhammaṃ, dāsidāsaṃ jātidhammaṃ, aj'eḷakaṃ jātidhammaṃ, kukkuṭasūkaraṃ jātidhammaṃ

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, anariyā pariyesanā? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā jātidhammo samāno jātidhammaṃ'y'eva pariyesati, attanā jarādhammo samāno jarādhammaṃ'y'eva pariyesati

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
jātidhammavagga

masc. Chapter 4 of the Saḷāyatanasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 4 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
jātidhammādisuttadasaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.33-42 (SN35.33-42) ✗
jātinidāna

adj. having birth as the source [jāti + nidāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having birth as the source
Construction jāti + nidāna
Commentary (PMa) yasmā pana tassa jāti yathāvuttena atthena nidānañ'c'eva samudayo ca jāti ca pabhavo ca, tasmā jātinidānan'tiādim'āha.
jātinirodha

masc. ending of birth; cessation of rebirth [jāti + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of birth; cessation of rebirth
Construction jāti + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jātiyā + nirodha)
Sanskrit jāti + nirodha

Examples

vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

jātisamudayā jarāmaraṇasamudayo jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇanirodho

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
jātinirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of birth; leading to the cessation of conception [jātinirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of birth; leading to the cessation of conception
Construction jātinirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātinirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit jāti + nirodha + gāmin

Example

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako jātiñca pajānāti, jātisamudayañ'ca pajānāti, jātinirodhañ'ca pajānāti, jātinirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
jātinirodhasāruppagāmī

adj. suitable for leading to the end of birth [jātinirodha + sāruppa + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning suitable for leading to the end of birth
Construction jātinirodha + sāruppa + gāmī
jātipaccayā

ind. dependent on birth; due to birth; lit. from condition of birth [jāti + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of jātipaccaya
Meaning dependent on birth; due to birth; lit. from condition of birth
Construction jāti + paccaya + ā
jātipaccaya + ā
Sanskrit jāti + pratyayāt

Examples

vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

na kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, sayaṃkataṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ, na paraṃkataṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ, na sayaṃkatañ'ca paraṃkatañ'ca jarāmaraṇaṃ, n'āpi asayaṃkāraṃ aparaṃkāraṃ adhiccasamuppannaṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ. api ca, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
jātipapāta

masc. cliff of birth; precipice of becoming [jāti + papāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cliff of birth; precipice of becoming
Construction jāti + papāta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jātiyā + papāta)
Sanskrit jāti + prapāta

Example

te jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā jarāsaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā ... jātipapātam'pi papatanti, jarāpapātam'pi papatanti

jātippabhava

masc. birthplace; lit. source of birth [jāti + pabhava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning birthplace; lit. source of birth
Construction jāti + pabhava
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jātiyā + pabhava)
Commentary (SNPa) dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī'ti vaṭṭadukkhassa jātikāraṇaṃ, upadhī'ti anupassanto.
Sanskrit jāti + prabhava

Examples

yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā,
yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī'ti.

jātiphala

nt. nutmeg ✗

Meaning peril of birth; danger of rebirth
Construction jāti + bhaya
Commentary (ANa) jātibhayan'ti jātiṃ ārabbha uppajjanakabhayaṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
jātibhava

masc. birth and being; rebirth and becoming [jāti + bhava] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp

Sanskrit jāti + bhava

Example

paññā hi seṭṭhā lokasmiṃ,
yāyaṃ nibbedhagāminī,
yāya sammā pajānāti,
jātibhavaparikkhayaṃ.

ITI41 paññāparihīnasuttaṃ
jātibhūmaka

jātibhūma + ka

Variant jātibhūmika
Commentary (MNa) jātibhūmikā'ti jātibhūmivāsino.
Sanskrit jāti + bhūmikā

Example

Sanskrit jāti + bhūmi

Example

ko nu kho, bhikkhave, jātibhūmiyaṃ jātibhūmakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ evaṃ sambhāvito, attanā ca app'iccho app'icchakathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā, attanā ca santuṭṭho santuṭṭhikathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā

Sanskrit jāti + bhūmikā
jātimant 1

adj. genuine; of good origin; lit. having birth quality [√jan + ti + mant] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāti
Meaning genuine; of good origin; lit. having birth quality
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + ti + mant
jāti + mant
Derivative taddhita (mant)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Commentary (SNa) jātimā'ti jātisampanno.
Sanskrit jātimat
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭh'aṃso suparikammakato paṇḍukambale nikkhitto bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

nt. birth and death [jāti + maraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning birth and death

Examples

te yogayuttā mārassa,
ayogakkhemino janā,
sattā gacchanti saṃsāraṃ,
jātimaraṇagāmino.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ

jātimaraṇasaṃsāraṃ,
ye vajanti punappunaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
avijjāy'eva sā gati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
jātimaraṇagāmī

adj. leading to birth and death [jāti + maraṇa + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to birth and death
