Sanskrit jāti + maraṇa + gāmin

Example

sattā gacchanti saṃsāraṃ,
jātimaraṇagāmino,
ye ca kāme pariññāya,
bhavayogañca sabbaso.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
jātimaraṇabhaya

nt. fear of birth and death; (or) the danger which is birth and death [jātimaraṇa + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fear of birth and death; (or) the danger which is birth and death
Construction jātimaraṇa + bhaya
Commentary (ANa) jātimaraṇabhayassā'ti jātiñ'ca maraṇañ'ca paṭicca uppajjanakabhayassa, jātimaraṇasaṅkhātass'eva vā bhayassa.
jātimaraṇamaccagā

imperf. surpassed birth and death [jātimaraṇaṃ + accagā] ✓

Grammar imperf, comp vb
Meaning surpassed birth and death
Construction jātimaraṇaṃ + accagā
Commentary (ITIa) jātimaraṇam'accagā'ti evaṃ sammasanto vipassanāñāṇaṃ maggena ghaṭetvā maggaparamparāya arahattaṃ patto jātimaraṇaṃ atīto nāma hoti.
Sanskrit jāti + maraṇa + ati + agacchat

Example

kāyañ'ca bhiduraṃ ñatvā,
viññāṇañ'ca virāgunaṃ,
upadhīsu bhayaṃ disvā,
jātimaraṇam'accagā,
sampatvā paramaṃ santiṃ,
kālaṃ kaṅkhati bhāvitatto'ti.

jātiya

adj. being of such a kind, of such a class(?) or type of birth, class, lineage(?) ✗

Meaning name of a wood; lit. Jātiyā's grove

Commentary (ANa) jātiyāvane'ti sayaṃjāte aropite himavantena saddhiṃ ekābaddhe vanasaṇḍe, taṃ nagaraṃ upanissāya tasmiṃ vane viharatī'ti attho.
jātilesa

masc. caste as a pretext [jāti + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning caste as a pretext
Construction jāti + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (jāti + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) jātileso nāma khattiyo diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ khattiyaṃ passitvā codeti, khattiyo mayā diṭṭho
Sanskrit jāti + leśa

Example

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

Sanskrit jātivāda (bsk)

Example

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

anekajātisaṃsāraṃ,
sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakārakaṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

DHP 153 jarāvaggo
jātisuttādidasaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.72-81 (SN12.72-81) ✗
jātisumanā

fem. jasmine ✗
jātissara

adj. remembering former births ✗
jātihiṅgulaka

nt. natural vermilion ✗
jātihīna

adj. from humble background; of low rank; lit. low birth [jāti + hīna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning from humble background; of low rank; lit. low birth
Construction jāti + hīna
Compound kammadhāraya (jāti + hīna)
Commentary (SNa) jātihīnan'ti api caṇḍālakulā pabbajitaṃ
Sanskrit jātihīna

Examples

kiṃsu mātā pitā bhātā,
vandanti naṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ,
kiṃsu idha jātihīnaṃ,
abhivādenti khattiyā'ti.

SN 1.81 araṇasuttaṃ

samaṇaṃ mātā pitā bhātā,
vandanti naṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ,
samaṇ'īdha jātihīnaṃ,
abhivādenti khattiyā'ti.

SN 1.81 araṇasuttaṃ
jātīmaraṇagāmī

adj. leading to birth and death [jāti + maraṇa + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to birth and death
Construction jāti + maraṇa + gāmī
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (jātimaraṇaṃ + gāmī)
Variant jātimaraṇagāmī
Commentary (ITIa) jātimaraṇagāmino punappunaṃ jananamaraṇass'eva upagamanasīlā'ti.
Sanskrit jāti + maraṇa + gāmin

Example

taṇhāyogena saṃyuttā,
rattacittā bhav'ābhave,
te yogayuttā mārassa,
ayogakkhemino janā,
sattā gacchanti saṃsāraṃ,
jātīmaraṇagāmino.

ITI58 taṇhāsuttaṃ
jātu

ind. most certainly; undoubtedly ✓

Grammar ind, emph
Meaning most certainly; undoubtedly
Sanskrit jātu

Examples

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
jātūpanisa

adj. with birth as pre-condition [jāti + upanisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with birth as pre-condition
Construction jāti + upanisa
jātosmi

sandhi. I am the kind of person; lit. kind I am [jāto + asmi] ~

Grammar sandhi, masc + pr
Meaning I am the kind of person; lit. kind I am
Construction jāto + asmi
Sanskrit jātaḥ + asmi
jāna

adj. knowing; being aware (of); understanding [√ñā + nā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jānāti
Meaning knowing; being aware (of); understanding
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym dassī, vijāna, vidū
Sanskrit jñāna
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

dujjānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, bhante, bhagavato vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ, mayhaṃ vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ. desetu me, bhante bhagavā, dhammaṃ, desetu, sugato, dhammaṃ, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatr'āyogena aññatr'ācariyakena, saññā purisassa attā'ti vā, aññā'va saññā añño attā'ti vā'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
jānaka

nt. knowledge, recognition [√ñā] ✗
jānatā

prp. (+acc) by the one who knows; lit. by knowing [√ñā + nā + nta + tā] ✓

Grammar prp, masc instr sg of jānanta, trans (+acc)
Meaning by the one who knows; lit. by knowing
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + nta + tā
jānanta + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym pajānatā, vijānatā
Commentary (MNa) jānatā'ti sabbadhamme jānantena buddhena.
Sanskrit jānatā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

ayaṃ loko paro loko,
jānatā suppakāsito,
yañ'ca mārena sampattaṃ,
appattaṃ yañ'ca maccunā.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
jānato passato

idiom. when knowing and seeing; for one who knows and sees ✓

Grammar idiom, prp + prp
Meaning when knowing and seeing; for one who knows and sees

Examples

duddasaṃ anataṃ nāma,
na hi saccaṃ sudassanaṃ,
paṭividdhā taṇhā jānato,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

UD 72 dutiyanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
jānapaṭicchanna

adj. knowingly concealed ✗
jānapada 1

adj. rural; of countryside; of the land [jana + pada + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from janapada
Meaning rural; of countryside; of the land
Construction jana > jāna + pada + *a
janapada + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (jāna + pada)
Antonym negama
Commentary (DNa) jānapadā'ti janapadavāsino.
Sanskrit jānapada

Examples

tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṃ loṇam'pi telam'pi taṇḍulam'pi khādanīyam'pi sakaṭesu āropetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake sakaṭaparivaṭṭaṃ karitvā acchanti

VIN 4.6.179 kappiyabhūmi anujānanā

idh'ev'āhaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessāmī'ti. assosuṃ kho jānapadā bhikkhū, bhagavā kira tatth'eva sāvatthiyaṃ komudiṃ cātumāsiniṃ āgamessatī'ti.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
jānapada 2

masc. rural person; (pl) country folk [jana + pada + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from janapada
Meaning rural person; (pl) country folk
Construction jana > jāna + pada + *a
janapada + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (jāna + pada)
Sanskrit jānapada

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamārūḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
jānapadika 1

adj. belonging to the country ✗

masc. rustic, (pl) country-folk ✗
jānamāna

Example

anupādiseso'ti jānamāno so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho purisa, ubbhataṃ kho te sallaṃ, apanīto visadoso anupādiseso. analañ'ca te antarāyāya.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

addhā ayam'āyasmā jānaṃ jānāti passaṃ passatī'ti. ayam'pi dhammo piyattāya garuttāya bhāvanāya sāmaññāya ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

Phonetic Change ñ > j
Antonym ajānaṃ
Sanskrit jñānatas
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya, yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 16 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjeyya aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, pācittiyaṃ.

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

Example

Examples

ehi tvaṃ, tāta uttara, yena samaṇo gotamo ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ jānāhi yadi vā taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ tathā santaṃ'y'eva saddo abbhuggato, yadi vā no tathā

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

manussasaddo viya suyyati, jānissāma nan'ti saddānusārena gantvā taṃ purisaṃ disvā, yakkho bhavissatī'ti bhītatasitā sare sannayhiṃsu

JAa 466 samuddavāṇija jātakavaṇṇanā

jānāmahaṃ

sandhi. I know; I understand [jānāmi + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pr + pron
Meaning I know; I understand
Construction jānāmi + ahaṃ
Sanskrit jānāmi + aham

Examples

iti jānāmi iti passāmī'ti jānām'ahaṃ ete dhamme, passām'ahaṃ ete dhamme, atthi ca ete dhammā mayi, ahañ'ca etesu dhammesu sandissāmī'ti.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ

tena hi bhavaṃ na jānāti, na passatī'ti? na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, na jānāmi na passāmi. jānām'ahaṃ, āvuso, passāmī'ti .

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
jānāmi

Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + mi

Example

jānām'ahaṃ, āvuso, passāmī'ti vadesi. yathā kathaṃ pan'āvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
jāni 1.1

fem. (of property) confiscation; seizure; deprivation; loss [√hā + ni] ✓

Grammar fem, from jahati
Meaning (of property) confiscation; seizure; deprivation; loss
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Construction √hā > jā + ni
Derivative kita (ni)
Phonetic Change h > j
Sanskrit hāni
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Examples

vedanaṃ pharusaṃ jāniṃ,
sarīrassa ca bhedanaṃ,
garukaṃ v'āpi ābādhaṃ,
cittakkhepañ'ca pāpuṇe.

DHP 138 daṇḍavaggo

vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balav'amhi bal'attho iti'pi tadapi akusalaṃ.

mah'ācariyena vata kira, bho, saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha, āyasmā ānando'ti. sace hi mayaṃ jāneyyāma, ayaṃ āyasmā ānando'ti, ettakam'pi no nappaṭibhāyeyya. khamatu ca me āyasmā ānando'ti.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

VIN 2.5.7.4 duṭṭhullasikkhāpadaṃ
jānipatī

kaccāyana samāsakappa 339
jāniya 1.1

ger. (+acc) knowing; understanding [√ñā + nā + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of jānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning knowing; understanding
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + iya
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym aññāya, jaññā, paññāya, viññāya
Commentary (THIa) jāniyā'ti ... ñatvā.
Sanskrit jñāya
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

mayhañ'hi akkuṭṭhavandite,
sukhadukkhe ca satī upaṭṭhitā,
saṅkhatam'asubhan'ti jāniya,
sabbatth'eva mano na limpati.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
jāniya 2.1

adj. incurring a loss; having a misfortune [√hā + ni + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāni
Meaning incurring a loss; having a misfortune
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Construction √hā > jā + ni + iya
hāni + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change h > j
Sanskrit hāni +
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, mahājāniyo kho āḷāro kālāmo. sace hi so imaṃ dhammaṃ suṇeyya, khippam'eva ājāneyyā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
jāniyā

opt. (+acc) may know; could understand [√ñā + nā + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of jānāti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning may know; could understand

Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + eyya > iyā
Phonetic Change eyya > iya (Kacc 508, 515)
ñ > j
Sanskrit jñāyāt
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

ñā'icc'etassa dhātussa jā jaṃ nā'ādesā honti vā. jānāti, jāneyya, jāniyā, jaññā, nāyati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 470

eyyassa vibhattissa ñā'icc'etāya dhātuyā parassa iyā ñā ādesā honti vā. jāniyā, jaññā. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? jāneyya.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 508
jāniyāma

opt. (+acc) we may know; we could understand [√ñā + nā + eyyāma] ✓

Grammar opt 1st pl of jānātu, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning we may know; we could understand
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + eyyāma > iyāma
Phonetic Change eyya > iya (Kacc 508, 515)
ñ > j
Synonym jānemu
Variant jāneyyāma
Sanskrit jñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

kathaṃ sametassa vibhoti rūpaṃ,
sukhaṃ dukhañ'cā'pi kathaṃ vibhoti,
etaṃ me pabrūhi yathā vibhoti,
taṃ jāniyāmā'ti me mano ahu.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
jāniyāmase

imp. (+acc) we ourselves must know; we ourselves must understand [√ñā + nā + eyyāmase] ✓

Grammar imp 1st pl of jāniyā, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning we ourselves must know; we ourselves must understand
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + eyyāmase > iyāmase
Phonetic Change eyya > iya (Kacc 508, 515)
ñ > j
Variant jāneyyāma
Sanskrit jñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Example

kacci pahūtajivho'si,
yathā taṃ jāniyāmase,
ninnāmay'etaṃ pahūtaṃ,
kaṅkhaṃ vinaya no ise.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
jānu

nt. knee [jāṇu] ✗
jānuka

nt. knee [jāṇu] ✗
jānumaṇḍala

nt. knee-cap; knee ✗
jānussoni

masc. name of a rich Brahman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a rich Brahman
Variant jāṇusoṇī, jāṇussoṇi, jāṇussoṇī
Commentary (MNa) jāṇussoṇī'ti netaṃ tassa mātāpitūhi katanāmaṃ, apica kho ṭhān'antarapaṭilābhaladdhaṃ. jāṇussoṇiṭṭhānaṃ kira nām'etaṃ purohitaṭṭhānaṃ, taṃ tassa raññā dinnaṃ, tasmā jānussoṇī'ti vuccati.

Example

tena kho pana samayena jānussoni brāhmaṇo tadah'uposathe sīsaṃnhāto navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya bhagavato avidūre ekam'antaṃ ṭhito hoti.

AN 10.119 paṭhamapaccorohaṇīsuttaṃ
jānemu

opt. (+acc) we may know; we could understand [√ñā + nā + emu] ✓

Grammar opt 1st pl of jāneyya, trans (+acc)
Meaning we may know; we could understand
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + emu
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym jāniyāma
Commentary (SNa) kathaṃ jānemū'ti kathaṃ jāneyyāma.
Sanskrit jñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

kati lokasmiṃ pajjotā,
yehi loko pakāsati,
bhagavantaṃ puṭṭhum'āgamma,
kathaṃ jānemu taṃ mayan'ti.

SN 1.26 pajjotasuttaṃ
jāneyya

opt. (+acc) should know; should understand; should find out [√ñā + nā + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of jānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning should know; should understand; should find out
Root Family √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction jānā + eyya
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym vijaññā
Sanskrit jñāyāt, jñeyāt
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

Examples

tañ'ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo, na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto āvilo luḷito kalalībhūto andhakāre nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
jāneyyātha

opt. (+acc) you could know, understand, aware, find out [√ñā] ✗
jāpayati

pr. (+acc) causes to conquer [√ji + *āpaya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of jeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to conquer
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 *āpaya (conquer)
Base √ji + āpaya > jāpaya (caus)
Construction jāpaya + ti
Sanskrit jāpayati
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

yo na hanti na ghāteti,
na jināti na jāpaye,
mett'aṃso sabbabhūtānaṃ,
veraṃ tassa na kenacī'ti.

AN 8.1 mettāsuttaṃ
jāpetabba

ptp. should be confiscated [√hā] ✗
jāpetāya

ptp. fit to be fined; worthy to be fined; lit. to cause to be decreased [√hā + *āpe + tāya] ✓

Grammar ptp of hāpeti, caus
Meaning fit to be fined; worthy to be fined; lit. to cause to be decreased
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･3 *āpe (decrease)
Base √hā + āpe > hāpe > jāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction jāpe + tāya
Derivative kicca (tāya)
Phonetic Change h > j
Commentary (MNa) jāpetāyaṃ vā jāpetun'ti dhanajāni'rahaṃ jāpetabbayuttaṃ jāpetuṃ jiṇṇadhanaṃ kātuṃ.
Sanskrit hāpayitavya
Sanskrit Root √hā 1, 3 (leave)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, aggivessana, vatteyya rañño khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa sakasmiṃ vijite vaso, ghātetāyaṃ vā ghātetuṃ, jāpetāyaṃ vā jāpetuṃ, pabbājetāyaṃ vā pabbājetuṃ, seyyathā'pi rañño pasenadissa kosalassa, seyyathā'pi vā pana rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassā'ti?

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
jāpeti

pr. confiscates [√hā] ✗
jāpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to fine; to confiscate; lit. to cause to decrease [√hā + *āpe + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of hāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to fine; to confiscate; lit. to cause to decrease
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･3 *āpe (decrease)
Base √hā + āpe > hāpe > jāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction jāpe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change h > j
Sanskrit hāpayitum
Sanskrit Root √hā 1, 3 (leave)

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā app'ekaccaṃ urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ pahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, aggivessana, vatteyya rañño khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa sakasmiṃ vijite vaso, ghātetāyaṃ vā ghātetuṃ, jāpetāyaṃ vā jāpetuṃ, pabbājetāyaṃ vā pabbājetuṃ, seyyathā'pi rañño pasenadissa kosalassa, seyyathā'pi vā pana rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassā'ti?

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
jāmātar

masc. son-in-law ✗
jāmātara

masc. son-in-law ✗
jāyatana

nt. state of being a wife; marriage [√jan] ✗
jāyati 1

pr. (+abl or +loc) is born (in); comes into being (from) [√jan + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+abl or +loc)
Meaning is born (in); comes into being (from)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction jāya + ti
Synonym jāyate
Sanskrit janyate
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa

DN 14.11 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā ass'ājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
jāyati 2

pr. (+loc) arises (in); is produced (from) [√jan + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning arises (in); is produced (from)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction jāya + ti
Phonetic Change jāyatī with metrically lengthened ī
Synonym pabhavati, sambhoti
Sanskrit janati
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Examples

piyato jāyatī soko,
piyato jāyatī bhayaṃ,
piyato vippamuttassa,
n'atthi soko kuto bhayaṃ.

DHP 212 piyavaggo

pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vediyati, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
jāyate

pr. (+loc) is born (in); comes into being (from) [√jan + ya + te] ✓

Grammar pr, reflx 3rd sg of jāyati, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is born (in); comes into being (from)
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction jāya + te
Synonym jāyati
Sanskrit janyate
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

kattari ca attanopadāni honti. maññate, rocate, socate, bujjhate, jāyate.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 454
jāyattana

nt. wife; wifehood; lit. wife state [√jan + yā + ttana] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from jāyā
Meaning wife; wifehood; lit. wife state
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction √jan > jā + yā + ttana
jāyā + ttana
Derivative taddhita (ttana)
Phonetic Change an > ā
Antonym jārattana
Commentary (VIN 1.2.5) jāyattane vā'ti jāyā bhavissasi.
Sanskrit jāyātva
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā, antamaso taṅ'khaṇikāya'pi, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 5 sañcarittasikkhāpadaṃ
jāyana

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
jāyamāna

prp. being born; coming into being; arising [√jan + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of jāyati, pass, intrans
Meaning being born; coming into being; arising
Root Family √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction jāya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym ajāyamāna
Synonym uppajjamāna
Sanskrit jāyamāna
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

Example

tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo gaho,

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
jāla 2

masc. blaze; burn; glow [√jal] ✗

Meaning network of leaf buds; lit. small net

jāla + ka

Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (ANa) jālakajāto'ti sañjātapattapupphajālo. tassa hi pattajālañ'ca pupphajālañ'ca sah'eva nikkhamati.
Sanskrit jālaka
Sanskrit Root √jal 10 (cover up)

Example

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pāricchattako koviḷāro pannapalāso hoti, attamanā, bhikkhave, devā tāvatiṃsā tasmiṃ samaye honti, pannapalāso dāni pāricchattako koviḷāro nacirass'eva dāni jālakajāto bhavissatī'ti.

Commentary (ANa) jālakajāto'ti sañjātapattapupphajālo. tassa hi pattajālañ'ca pupphajālañca sah'eva nikkhamati.

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pāricchattako koviḷāro pannapalāso hoti, attamanā, bhikkhave, devā tāvatiṃsā tasmiṃ samaye honti, pannapalāso dāni pāricchattako koviḷāro nacirass'eva dāni jālakajāto bhavissatī'ti.

AN 7.69 pāricchattakasuttaṃ
jālakkhika

nt. mesh of a net ✗

jālapacchanna

adj. covered by a net ✗
jālapūva

masc. pancake ✗
jālamutta

adj. freed from the net; escaped from the snare [jāla + mutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning freed from the net; escaped from the snare
Construction jāla + mutta
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (jālato + mutta)
Commentary (DHPa) jālamutto'vā'ti yathā chekena sākuṇikena jālena ottharitvā gayhamānesu vaṭṭakesu koci'd'eva jālato muccati. sesā antojālam'eva pavisanti. tathā maraṇajālena otthaṭesu sattesu bahū apāyagāmino honti
Sanskrit jāla + mukta

Example

andhabhūto ayaṃ loko,
tanuk'ettha vipassati,
sakuṇo jālamutto'va,
appo saggāya gacchati.

DHP13 lokavaggo
jālayamāna

prp. (+acc) kindling, lighting [√jal] ✗
jālasañchanna

adj. enveloped by the net; ensnared in the netting; lit. covered with a net [jāla + sañchanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enveloped by the net; ensnared in the netting; lit. covered with a net
Construction jāla + sañchanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jālena + sañchanna)
Commentary (UDa) jālasañchannā'ti sakattabhāvaparattabhāvesu ajjhattikabāhir'āyatanesu, tannissitesu ca dhammesu atīt'ādivasena anekabhedabhinnesu heṭṭh'upariyavasena apar'āparaṃ uppattiyā ant'ogadhānaṃ anatthāvahato ca jālabhūtāya taṇhāya sukhumacchiddena jālena parivuto viya udakarahado sañchannā paliguṇṭhitā ajjhotthaṭā.
Sanskrit jāla + saṃchanna

Example

kām'andhā jālasañchannā,
taṇhāchadanachāditā,
pamattabandhunā baddhā,
macchā'va kumināmukhe,
jarāmaraṇam'anventi,
vaccho khīrapako'va mātaran'ti.

UD64 dutiyasattasuttaṃ
jālasadisa

adj. like a net [jāla + sadisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a net
Construction jāla + sadisa
jālasadisatta

nt. fact of being like a net [jāla + sadisa + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of being like a net
Construction jāla + sadisa + tta
jālasadisa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
jālahatthapāda

adj. with lined hands and feet; (comm) with equal length digits; sixth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. with netted hands and feet [jāla + hattha + pāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with lined hands and feet; (comm) with equal length digits; sixth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. with netted hands and feet
Construction jāla + hattha + pāda
Compound kammadhāraya (jāla + hatthapāda)
Commentary (MNa) jālahatthapādo'ti na cammena paṭibaddh'āṅgul'antaro. ediso hi phaṇahatthako purisadosena upahato pabbajjaṃ na paṭilabhati. mahāpurisassa pana catasso hatth'aṅguliyo pañca'pi pād'aṅguliyo ekappamāṇā honti, tāsaṃ ekappamāṇatāya yavalakkhaṇaṃ aññam'aññaṃ paṭivijjhitvā tiṭṭhati. ath'assa hatthapādā kusalena vaḍḍhakinā yojitajālavātapānasadisā honti. tena vuttaṃ, jālahatthapādo'ti.
Sanskrit jāla + hastapāda, jālahastapāda (bsk)

Example

jālahatthapādo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
jālā

fem. flame [√jal] ✗
jālākula

adj. surrounded by flames ✗
jālāvātapāna

nt. lattice window or shutter ✗
jālāsaṅkhāta

adj. (that) which is called a net ✗
jālāhatthapāda

adj. with "netted" hands and feet, probably with hands and feet marked with a network of lines (one of the 32 marks of a great man) ✗
jālika

masc. fisherman who uses a net ✗
jālikā

fem. armour made of chain ✗
jālita 1

pp. shone, burnt [√jal] ✗
jālita 2

pp. kindled, lighted [√jal] ✗
jālinī

adj. entangling; ensnaring; deceptive; lit. having a net [√jal + *ī + inī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of jālī
Meaning entangling; ensnaring; deceptive; lit. having a net
Root Family √jal
Root √jal×8 *e (hide, conceal)
Construction √jal > jāl + *ī + inī
jālī + inī
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit jālin
Sanskrit Root √jal 10 (cover up)

Examples

yassa jālinī visattikā,
taṇhā n'atthi kuhiñci netave,
taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

DHP 180 buddhavaggo

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
jāliya

masc. name of an ascetic's student ✗
jāliyasutta

nt. Dīgha Nikāya 7 (DN 7) ✗
jālī 1.1

adj. entangling; ensnaring; deceptive; lit. having a net [√jal + *a + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāla
Meaning entangling; ensnaring; deceptive; lit. having a net
Root Family √jal
Root √jal×8 *e (hide, conceal)
Construction √jal > jāl + *a + ī
jāla + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym visattika
Commentary (ANa) jālinin'ti jālasadisaṃ. yathā hi jālaṃ samantato saṃsibbitaṃ ākulabyākulaṃ, evaṃ taṇhāpīti jālasadisattā jālinī'ti vuttā. tayo vā bhave ajjhottharitvā ṭhitāya etissā tattha tattha attano koṭṭhāsabhūtaṃ jālaṃ atthī'ti'pi jālinī.
Sanskrit jālin
Sanskrit Root √jal 10 (cover up)

Examples

yassa jālinī visattikā,
taṇhā n'atthi kuhiñci netave,
taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

DHP 180 buddhavaggo

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
jālī 1.2

masc. lust, desire, craving [√jal] ✗
jālī 1.3

adj. webbed [√jal] ✗
jālī 2.1

adj. burning; blazing; glowing [√jal + *a + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from jāla
Meaning burning; blazing; glowing
Root Family √jal
Root √jal･1 a (shine, blaze)
√ In Comps jjal
Construction √jal > jāl + *a + ī
jāla + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ādittaka, jalita, paditta, sajotibhūta
Commentary (SNa) jālinan'ti jālavantaṃ.
Sanskrit jvālin
Sanskrit Root √jval 1 (burn, flame)

Example

pahūtabhakkhaṃ jālinaṃ,
pāvakaṃ kaṇhavattaniṃ,
daharo'ti n'āvajāneyya,
na naṃ paribhave naro.

jāleti

pr. (+acc) kindles, lights, causes to burn [√jal] ✗

jālenta

prp. (+acc) kindling, lighting [√jal] ✗

aor. (+acc) kindled, lighted [√jal] ✗
ji

adj. winning; victorious; conquering [√ji + i] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jināti
Meaning winning; victorious; conquering
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Construction √ji + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit ji
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Example

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaji-uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

DHP 103 sahassavaggo
jigiṃsaka

adj. desirous of [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsati

pr. (+acc) desires; wants; wishes to get; lit. wants to conquer [√ji + sa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of jayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; wants; wishes to get; lit. wants to conquer
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigiṃsa (desid)
Construction jigiṃsa + ti
Phonetic Change har > gī (Kacc 474, 535)
Synonym āsīsati
Variant jigīsati
Notes Kaccāyana takes it as √har.
Sanskrit jigīṣati
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse,
desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena,
adassanaṃ'y'eva tadajjhagamā'ti.

JA 253 maṇikaṇṭha jātakaṃ
jigiṃsanā

fem. covetousness, desire for [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsanta

prp. (+acc) desiring; wanting; lit. wanting to conquer [√ji + sa + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jigiṃsati, desid, trans (+acc)
Meaning desiring; wanting; lit. wanting to conquer
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigiṃsa (desid)
Construction jigiṃsa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change har > gī (Kacc 474, 535)
Synonym abhijjhāyanta, icchanta, icchamāna, kāmayamāna, kāmayāna, jappanta
Variant jigīsanta
Notes Kaccāyana takes it as √har.
Sanskrit jigīṣat
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

so puṇṇako kāmavegena giddho,
irandhatiṃ nāgakaññaṃ jigiṃsaṃ,
gantvāna taṃ bhūtapatiṃ yasassiṃ,
iccabravī vessavaṇaṃ kuveraṃ.

JA 546 vidhura jātakaṃ
jigiṃsamāna

prp. wanting; desiring [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsā

fem. covetousness, desire for [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsāna

prp. desiring; wanting [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsi

aor. desired [√ji] ✗
jigiṃsita

pp. desired [√ji] ✗
jigīsati

pr. (+acc) desires; wants; wishes to get; lit. wants to conquer [√ji + sa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of jayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; wants; wishes to get; lit. wants to conquer
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigīsa (desid)
Construction jigīsa + ti
Phonetic Change har > gī (Kacc 474, 535)
Synonym āsīsati
Variant jigiṃsati
Notes Kaccāyana takes it as √har.
Sanskrit jigīṣati
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Examples

bhuja ghasa hara su pā'icc'evam'ādīhi dhātūhi tum'icch'atthesu kha cha sa'icc'ete paccayā honti vā. bhottum'icchati, bubhukkhati, ghasitum'icchati, jighacchati, haritum'icchati, jigīsati, sotum'icchati, sussusati, pātum'icchati, pivāsati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 434

abbhāse vattamānassa kavaggassa cavaggo hoti. cikicchati, jigucchati, jighacchati, jigīsati, jaṅgamati, caṅkamati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 462
jigīsanta

prp. (+acc) desiring; wanting; lit. wanting to conquer [√ji + sa + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jigiṃsati, desid, trans (+acc)
Meaning desiring; wanting; lit. wanting to conquer
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigīsa (desid)
Construction jigīsa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change har > gī (Kacc 474, 535)
Synonym abhijjhāyanta, icchanta, icchamāna, kāmayamāna, kāmayāna, jappanta
Variant jigiṃsanta
Notes Kaccāyana takes it as √har.
Sanskrit jigīṣat
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Examples

mam'eva etaṃ na hi tvaṃ paresaṃ,
sannāhakāle paridevitena kiṃ,
sabbaṃ idaṃ calam'iti pekkhamāno,
abhinikkhamiṃ amatapadaṃ jigīsaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
jigīsamāna

prp. wanting; desiring [√ji] ✗
jigīsāna

prp. desiring; wanting [√ji] ✗
jigucchaka

adj. (+instr) who is repulsed (by); who is disgusted (with); who detests; who is sick (of); lit. wishing to avoid [√gup + cha + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from jigucchati, desid (+instr)
Meaning who is repulsed (by); who is disgusted (with); who detests; who is sick (of); lit. wishing to avoid
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change g > j
Synonym jegucchī
Sanskrit jugup
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīgarahakā pathavījigucchakā, āpagarahakā āpajigucchakā, tejagarahakā tejajigucchakā, vāyagarahakā vāyajigucchakā

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
jigucchati 1

pr. (+instr) detests; is disgusted (by); gets sick (of); loathes; is repulsed (by); lit. wishes to avoid [√gup + cha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of √gup, trans (+instr)
Meaning detests; is disgusted (by); gets sick (of); loathes; is repulsed (by); lit. wishes to avoid
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + ti
Phonetic Change g > j
Synonym dussati
Commentary (ANa) jiguccheyyā'ti jigucchaṃ āpajjeyya.
Sanskrit jugupsiṣate
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Examples

byādhidhammā jarādhammā,
atho maraṇadhammino,
yathā dhammā tathā sattā,
jigucchanti puthujjanā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, āpasmiṃ sucim'pi dhovanti, asucim'pi dhovanti, gūthagatam'pi dhovanti … na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā

jigucchati 2

pr. (+acc) shuns [√gup] ✗

jigucchanta

prp. (+acc) shunning; detesting; disliking; being repulsed; lit. wishing to avoid [√gup + cha + nta] ✓

Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

so lābhasakkāraṃ jigucchanto pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā, pahomi c'āhaṃ lābh'ālābh'ādīsu nibbikāro hotun'ti attānaṃ takkento, visesato paraparibhavasahanādipaṭipadaṃ pūrento upekkhāpāramiṃ matthakaṃ pāpessāmī'ti

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā

Examples

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, atidhāvanti eke? bhaven'eva kho pan'eke aṭṭīyamānā harāyamānā jigucchamānā vibhavaṃ abhinandanti

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

te iminā kāyena aṭṭīyamānā harāyamānā jigucchamānā satthahārakaṃ pariyesanti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
jigucchā

fem. something abhorrent; self-torture; (comm) abhorrence of evil; lit. wishing to avoid [√gup + cha + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from jigucchati, desid
Meaning something abhorrent; self-torture; (comm) abhorrence of evil; lit. wishing to avoid
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change g > j
Commentary (SNa) tapojigucchāyā'ti kāyakilamathatapena pāpajigucchanena.
Sanskrit jugupsā
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

tapojigucchāya susaṃvut'atto,
vācaṃ pahāya kalahaṃ janena,
samosavajjā virato saccavādī,
na hi nūna t'ādisaṃ karoti pāpan'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
jigucchi

aor. shunned, loathed [√gup] ✗
jigucchita

pp. shunned; detested; loathed; repulsed [√gup + cha + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of jigucchati, desid
Meaning shunned; detested; loathed; repulsed
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change g > j
Sanskrit jugupsita
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

tam'ūpanissāya jigucchitaṃ vā,
athavā'pi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
jigucchitabba

ptp. (+instr) should be disgusted (by); should be repulsed (by); lit. to be disgusted [√gup + cha + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of jigucchati, desid (+instr)
Meaning should be disgusted (by); should be repulsed (by); lit. to be disgusted
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change g > j
Commentary (MNa) aṭṭīyitabban'ti aṭṭena pīḷitena bhavitabbaṃ. harāyitabban'ti lajjitabbaṃ. jigucchitabban'ti gūthaṃ disvā viya jigucchā uppādetabbā.
Sanskrit jugupsitavya
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Examples

evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
jigucchitabbasutta

Grammar abs of jigucchati, desid, trans (+instr)
Meaning having detested; having become disgusted (by); having got sick (of); having been repulsed (by)

Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha + itvā

Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
jigucchiya

ger. shunning, loathing [√gup] ✗
jighacchati

pr. wishes to eat; is hungry; lit. wants to eat [√ghas + cha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of ghasati, intrans
Meaning wishes to eat; is hungry; lit. wants to eat
Root Family √ghas
Root √ghas･1 cha (eat)
Base √ghas + ghas + sa > jighaccha (desid)
Construction jighaccha + ti
Phonetic Change g > j
Sanskrit jighatsati
Sanskrit Root √gras 1 (devour)

Examples

bhuja ghasa hara su pā'icc'evam'ādīhi dhātūhi tum'icch'atthesu kha cha sa'icc'ete paccayā honti vā. bhottum'icchati, bubhukkhati, ghasitum'icchati, jighacchati, haritum'icchati, jigīsati, sotum'icchati, sussusati, pātum'icchati, pivāsati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 434

abbhāse vattamānassa kavaggassa cavaggo hoti. cikicchati, jigucchati, jighacchati, jigīsati, jaṅgamati, caṅkamati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 462
jighacchanta

prp. being hungry [√ghas] ✗
jighacchā

fem. hunger; lit. wanting to eat [√ghas + cha + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from jighacchati, desid
Meaning hunger; lit. wanting to eat
Root Family √ghas
Root √ghas･1 cha (eat)
Base √ghas + ghas + sa > jighaccha (desid)
Construction jighaccha + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change g > j
Antonym dhāta, pipāsā
Synonym anasana, khudā, khuddā
Sanskrit jighatsā
Sanskrit Root √gras 1 (devour)

Examples

jighacchāparamā rogā,
saṅkhāraparamā dukhā,
etaṃ ñatvā yathābhūtaṃ,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 203 sukhavaggo

khamā bhavissāma sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ
jighacchādubbalya

nt. hunger and weakness [jighacchā + dubbalya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning hunger and weakness
Construction jighacchā + dubbalya
Compound dvanda (jighacchā ca dubbalya ca)
Variant jighacchādubballa
Sanskrit jighatsā + daurbalya

Examples

kiñ'cā'pi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā jighacchādubbalyaṃ paṭivinodetvā evaṃ taṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyya, atha kho asu'y'eva me purimo bhikkhu pujjataro ca pāsaṃsataro ca

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, api nu kho so kukkuro amuṃ aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ palehanto jighacchādubbalyaṃ paṭivineyyā'ti?

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
jighacchādubbalyapareta

adj. afflicted with hunger and weakness; overcome by hunger and lack of strength [jighacchā + dubbalya + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with hunger and weakness; overcome by hunger and lack of strength
Construction jighacchā + dubbalya + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jighacchādubbalyena + pareta)
Commentary (MNa) jighacchādubbalyaparetā'ti jighacchāya ca dubbalyena ca paretā phuṭṭhā anugatā ca aṭṭha'pi dasa'pi divasāni. tattha keci jighacchitā'pi na dubbalā honti, sakkonti jighacchaṃ sahituṃ. ime pana na t'ādisā'ti dassetuṃ ubhayam'āha
Sanskrit jighatsā + daurbalya + parīta

Examples

evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṃ adhigaccheyya, so yato yato sāyeyya, labheth'eva sādurasaṃ asecanakaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, kukkuro jighacchādubbalyapareto goghātakasūnaṃ paccupaṭṭhito assa.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
jighacchādubballa

nt. hunger and weakness [jighacchā + dubballa] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning hunger and weakness
Construction jighacchā + dubballa
Compound dvanda (jighacchā ca dubballa ca)
Variant jighacchādubbalya
Sanskrit jighatsā + daurbalya

Example

kiñ'cā'pi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā jighacchādubballaṃ paṭivinodetvā evaṃ taṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyya, atha kho asu'y'eva me purimo bhikkhu pujjataro ca pāsaṃsataro ca

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ
jighacchāparama

adj. hunger is the very worst [jighacchā + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning hunger is the very worst
Construction jighacchā + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (jighacchā + paramā)
Commentary (DHPa) tattha jighacchāparamā rogā'ti yasmā añño rogo sakiṃ tikicchito vinassati vā tadaṅgavasena vā pahīyati, jighacchā pana niccakālaṃ tikicchitabbā'y'evā'ti sesarogānaṃ ayaṃ paramā nāma.
Sanskrit jighatsā + para, parama

Example

jighacchāparamā rogā,
saṅkhāraparamā dukhā,
etaṃ ñatvā yathābhūtaṃ,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP15 sukhavaggo
jighacchāpipāsā

fem. hunger and thirst [jighacchā + pipāsā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning hunger and thirst
Construction jighacchā + pipāsā
Compound dvanda (jighacchā ca pipāsā ca)
Synonym khuppipāsā
Sanskrit jighatsā + pipāsā

Example

hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati. pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati. pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati. kucchismiṃ sati jighacchāpipāsā paññāyati.

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ
jighacchi

aor. had a desire to eat [√ghas] ✗
jighacchita

pp. wanting to eat; hungry; lit. wanted to eat [√ghas + cha + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of jighacchati
Meaning wanting to eat; hungry; lit. wanted to eat
Root Family √ghas
Root √ghas･1 cha (eat)
Base √ghas + ghas + sa > jighaccha (desid)
Construction jighaccha + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (MNa) jighacchitānampī'ti chātānam'pi.
Sanskrit jighatsā, jighatsita (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √gras 1 (devour)

Example

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa sahadassanena amanāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, pāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jighacchitānam'pi na bhottukamyatā assa, pag'eva suhitānaṃ.

jiñjuka

masc. wild liquorice ✗
jiṇṇa 1

pp. aged; old; ancient; lit. worn out [√jīr + na] ✓

Meaning aged; old; ancient; lit. worn out

Root √jīr･1 a (grow old, decay)

Commentary (MNa) jiṇṇo'ti jarājiṇṇo.

Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Examples

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
jiṇṇa 2

Sanskrit jīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Examples

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

yattha pana mahantaṃ paribhavaṃ paṭilabhati, tattha ciram'pi vasati. so nivatth'avatthe jiṇṇe pilotikakhaṇḍena tasmim'pi jiṇṇe kenaci dinnaṃ aggaṇhanto hirikopīnapaṭicchādanamatten'eva carati. evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.

jiṇṇasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 16.5 (SN16.5) ✗
jita 1

nt. conquest; victory; triumph; lit. conquered [√ji + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of jināti
Meaning conquest; victory; triumph; lit. conquered
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Construction √ji + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym apajita
Synonym jaya
Sanskrit jita
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Examples

nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

sandhi. we are defeated! ✗

aparimeyyito kappe,
caturo āsuṃ vināyakā,
taṇhaṅkaro medhaṅkaro,
atho'pi saraṇaṅkaro,
dīpaṅkaro ca sambuddho,
ekakappamhi te jinā.

akammaṃ h'etaṃ, mahārāja, jinaputtānaṃ yadidaṃ pūjā, sammasanaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ, yoniso manasikāro, satipaṭṭhān'ānupassanā, ārammaṇasāraggāho, kilesayuddhaṃ, sadattham'anuyuñjanā, etaṃ jinaputtānaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, avasesānaṃ devamanussānaṃ pūjā karaṇīyā.

MJG

jinasāsana

nt. Buddha's teaching ✗
jināti 1

Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)

Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Examples

app'āpi santā bahuke jinanti,

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ

sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

DHP 354 taṇhāvaggo
jināti 2

pr. (+acc) surpasses; beats; wins (over) [√ji + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning surpasses; beats; wins (over)
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Base √ji + nā > jinā
Construction jinā + ti
Synonym jayati, jeti
Sanskrit jayati
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Example

sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

DHP 354 taṇhāvaggo
jini

aor. (+acc) won; was victorious [√ji + nā + i] ✓

Grammar aor of jināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning won; was victorious
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Base √ji + nā > jinā
Construction jinā + i
Sanskrit ajaiṣīt
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Example

tasmiṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, saṅgāme devā jiniṃsu, asurā parājiniṃsu.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
jinituṃ

inf. (+acc) to conquer; to overcome; to defeat [√ji + nā + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of jināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to conquer; to overcome; to defeat
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Base √ji + nā > jinā
Construction jinā + ituṃ
Synonym jetuṃ
Sanskrit jetum, jayitum
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)
jinitvā

abs. having conquered, having subdued [√ji] ✗
jine

opt. (+acc) could defeat; should conquer; could overcomes [√ji + nā + e] ✓

Grammar opt of jināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning could defeat; should conquer; could overcomes
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Base √ji + nā > jinā
Construction jinā + e
Synonym jeyya
Sanskrit jayet
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Examples

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

DHP 103 sahassavaggo

akkodhena jine kodhaṃ,
asādhuṃ sādhunā jine,
jine kadariyaṃ dānena,
saccen'ālikavādinaṃ.

DHP 223 kodhavaggo
jineyya

opt. (+acc) should conquer; would overcome [√ji + nā + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of jināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning should conquer; would overcome
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･5 nā (conquer)
Base √ji + nā > jinā
Construction jinā + eyya
Sanskrit ji
Sanskrit Root √ji √jyā 9 (conquer)

Example

sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe asurā jineyyuṃ devā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha asurapuran'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
jimha 1

nt. crooked part; skew piece ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning crooked part; skew piece
Commentary (MNa) jimhaṃ nāma sappagatamaggasadisaṃ.
Sanskrit jihma

Example

aho vat'āyaṃ samīti yānakāraputto imissā nemiyā imañ'ca vaṅkaṃ imañ'ca jimhaṃ imañ'ca dosaṃ taccheyya, ev'āyaṃ nemi apagatavaṅkā apagatajimhā apagatadosā suddhā assa sāre patiṭṭhitā'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
jimha 2

adj. crooked [jimha] ✗
jimha 3

adj. dishonest [jimha] ✗
jimhagatika

adj. with a crooked destination; with a skew destiny [jimha + gatika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from jimhagati
Meaning with a crooked destination; with a skew destiny
Construction jimha + gatika
Compound kammadhāraya (jimha + gatika)
Sanskrit jihma + gatika

Example

jimhagatikassa kho pan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, jimh'upapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi, ye vā ek'antadukkhā nirayā yā vā saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni. katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni?

AN 10.216 saṃsappanīyasuttaṃ
jimhatā

fem. crookedness, dishonesty [jimha] ✗
jimhatta

nt. crookedness; dishonesty; subterfuge [jimha + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from jimha
Meaning crookedness; dishonesty; subterfuge
Construction jimha + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym jimheyya
Sanskrit jaihmya
jimhaṃ

ind. crookedly; skew; off course [jimha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of jimha
Meaning crookedly; skew; off course
Construction jimha + aṃ
Antonym ujuṃ
Sanskrit jihma

Example

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

AN 4.70 adhammikasuttaṃ
jimhupapatti

Construction jimha + upapatti
Compound kammadhāraya (jimha + upapatti)
Sanskrit jihma + upapatti

Example

so saṃsappati kāyena, saṃsappati vācāya, saṃsappati manasā. tassa jimhaṃ kāyakammaṃ hoti, jimhaṃ vacīkammaṃ, jimhaṃ manokammaṃ, jimhā gati, jimh'upapatti.

AN 10.216 saṃsappanīyasuttaṃ
jimhupapattika

adj. who has a crooked destination; who has a skew destiny [jimha + upapattika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from jimhupapatti
Meaning who has a crooked destination; who has a skew destiny
Construction jimha + upapattika

Sanskrit jihma + aupapattika, upapattika (bsk)

Example

jimhagatikassa kho pan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, jimh'upapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi, ye vā ek'antadukkhā nirayā yā vā saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni. katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni?

AN 10.216 saṃsappanīyasuttaṃ
jimheyya

nt. crookedness; dishonesty; subterfuge [jimha + eyya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from jimha
Meaning crookedness; dishonesty; subterfuge
Construction jimha + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Synonym jimhatta
Commentary (MNa) jimheyyānī'ti jimhattāni. (ANa) jimheyyānī'ti jimhabhāvo.
Sanskrit jaihmya

Examples

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi, bhante, pahomi hatthidammaṃ sāretuṃ, yāvatakena antarena campaṃ gat'āgataṃ karissati sabbāni tāni sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni vaṅkeyyāni jimheyyāni pātukarissati.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
jiya

masc. bow string ~

Grammar masc
Meaning bow string
Synonym jiyā
Sanskrit jyā
jiyati 1.1

pr. is defeated, loses (something, accusative, in dicing or gambling) [√ji] ✗
jiyati 2.1

pr. grows old; decays, wears out; perishes [√jī] ✗
jiyati 2.2

pr. is oppressed; is deprived of; loses [√jī] ✗
jiyā

fem. bow string ~

Grammar fem
Meaning bow string
Synonym jiya
Sanskrit jyā
jiyābaddha

adj. fastened onto the bow string [jiyā + baddha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fastened onto the bow string
Construction jiyā + baddha
jiyāvega

masc. force of a bow string [jiyā + vega] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning force of a bow string
Construction jiyā + vega
jiyyati

pr. gets tired of; lit. grows old [√jī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning gets tired of; lit. grows old
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Base √jī + ya > jiyya
Construction jiyya + ti
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
Sanskrit jīryati
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Example

aniccā hi calā saddhā,
evaṃ diṭṭhā hi sā mayā,
rajjanti'pi virajjanti,
tattha kiṃ jiyyate muni.

TH 179 sāṭimattiyattheragāthā
jirati

pr. becomes old, decays [√jīr] ✗
jiridati

pr. (+inf) gets tired (of); (comm) never stops; (or) is ashamed (to) [√jīr + iya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of jīrati, irreg, intrans (+inf)
Meaning gets tired (of); (comm) never stops; (or) is ashamed (to)
Root Family √jīr
Root √jīr･1 iya (grow old, decay)
Base √jīr + iya > jiriya > jirida (pass, irreg)
Construction jirida + ti
Phonetic Change iya > ida
Commentary (ANa) na ca pan'ete'ti ete āyasmanto dīgharattaṃ avaṇṇakāmā hutvā avaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā'pi abbhācikkhantā na jiridanti, abbhakkhānassa antaṃ na gacchantī'ti attho. atha vā lajjan'atthe idaṃ jiridantī'ti padaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, na lajjantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit jīryati
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Example

na ca pan'ete āyasmanto jiridanti taṃ bhagavantaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhituṃ, na ca mayaṃ jīvitahetu'pi sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyyāmā'ti.

AN 8.12 sīhasuttaṃ

fem. tongue ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning tongue
Synonym jivhādhātu
Sanskrit jihvā

Examples

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,

udare saññato siyā.

jivhā sūparasaṃ yathā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkh'āyatanaṃ sot'āyatanaṃ ghān'āyatanaṃ jivh'āyatanaṃ kāy'āyatanaṃ man'āyatanaṃ

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ

Examples

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, viññāṇakāyā cakkhuviññāṇaṃ sotaviññāṇaṃ ghānaviññāṇaṃ jivhāviññāṇaṃ kāyaviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇaṃ idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning knowable by tasting; lit. to be known by tongue knowing
Construction jivhā + viññāṇa + viññātabba

Sanskrit jihvā + vijñāna + vijñātavya

Example

jivhaṃ, āvuso channa, jivhāviññāṇaṃ jivhāviññāṇaviññātabbe dhamme etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassasi?

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
jivhāviññeyya

adj. tastable; known by the tongue; lit. to be known by the tongue [jivhā + viññeyya] ✓

Examples

bhusā ce'pi jivhāviññeyyā rasā jivhāya āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti. amissīkatam'ev'assa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ vayañ'c'ass'ānupassati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

ye te jivhāviññeyyā rasā asāyitā asāyitapubbā, na ca sāyasi, na ca te hoti sāyeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

cakkhusamphasso... sotasamphasso... ghānasamphasso... jivhāsamphasso... kāyasamphasso... manosamphasso loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

Example

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

Examples

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ

jivhaṃ aññato passati, rūpe aññato passati, jivhāviññāṇaṃ aññato passati, jivhāsamphassaṃ aññato passati, yam'p'idaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā

SN 35.80 dutiyāvijjāpahānasuttaṃ
jivhāsamphassaviññāṇāyatana

nt. contact with the tongue and the corresponding field of consciousness; taste impression and the associated dimension of knowing [jivhāsamphassa + viññāṇāyatana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning contact with the tongue and the corresponding field of consciousness; taste impression and the associated dimension of knowing
Construction jivhāsamphassa + viññāṇāyatana
Commentary (SNa) cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanan'ti cakkhuviññāṇena sampayutto cakkhusamphasso'pi viññāṇ'āyatanam'pi mam'evā'ti. ettha ca cakkhusamphassena viññāṇasampayuttakā dhammā gahitā, viññāṇ'āyatanena sabbāni'pi cakkhudvāre uppannāni āvajjan'ādiviññāṇāni. sotadvār'ādīsu'pi eseva nayo.
jivhāsamphassāyatana

nt. field of taste experience; lit. tongue contact field [jivhā + samphassāyatana] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning field of taste experience; lit. tongue contact field
Construction jivhā + samphassāyatana
jivhindriya

nt. sense of taste; gustatory faculty; lit. tongue faculty [jivhā + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning sense of taste; gustatory faculty; lit. tongue faculty
Construction jivhā + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (jivhā + indriya)
Sanskrit jihvā + indriya

Examples

tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjissāma, rakkhissāma jivh'indriyaṃ, jivh'indriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjissāma

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

pañc'imāni, bho gotama, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti. katamāni pañca? cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, sot'indriyaṃ, ghān'indriyaṃ, jivh'indriyaṃ, kāy'indriyaṃ.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
jivhindriya 2

nt. tongue sense organ; gustatory sense base; lit. tongue faculty [jivhā + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning tongue sense organ; gustatory sense base; lit. tongue faculty
Construction jivhā + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (jivhā + indriya)
Sanskrit jihvā + indriya

Example

varaṃ, bhikkhave, tiṇhena khurena ādittena sampajjalitena sajotibhūtena jivh'indriyaṃ sampalimaṭṭhaṃ, na tv'eva jivhāviññeyyesu rasesu anubyañjanaso nimittaggāho.

SN 4 ādittapariyāyasuttaṃ
jivhindriyasaṃvara

masc. restraint of the sense of taste; lit. tongue faculty restraint [jivhindriya + saṃvara] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning restraint of the sense of taste; lit. tongue faculty restraint
Construction jivhindriya + saṃvara
Compound sattamī tappurisa (jivhindriye + saṃvara)
Sanskrit jihvā + indriya + saṃvara
jivhindriyasaṃvarasaṃvuta

adj. with the sense of taste restrained [jivhindriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the sense of taste restrained
Construction jivhindriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jivhindriyasaṃvarena + saṃvuta)
Sanskrit jihvā + indriya + saṃvara + saṃvṛta

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... sot'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... ghān'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... jivh'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... kāy'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... man'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati.

MN 2.3 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
jī

masc. conqueror; victor [√ji + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from jeti
Meaning conqueror; victor
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 a (conquer)
Construction √ji + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Synonym abhibhū, jina
Sanskrit ji
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

idha kho taṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammā vadamāno vadeyya, idaṃ jātu vedagū, idaṃ jātu sabbajī, idaṃ jātu apalikhataṃ gaṇḍamūlaṃ palikhaṇin'ti

SN 35.86 udakasuttaṃ
jīna 1

pp. (+acc) lost; been deprived (of); become poorer [√jī + na] ~

Grammar pp of jīyati (+acc)
Meaning lost; been deprived (of); become poorer
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Construction √jī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Sanskrit jīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)
jīna 2

pp. diminished [√jī] ✗
jīna 3

pp. become old, decayed [√jī] ✗
jīmūta

masc. rain cloud ✗
jīyati 1.1

pr. diminishes; decreases; gets less; is lost [√jī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning diminishes; decreases; gets less; is lost
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Base √jī + ya > jīya
Construction jīya + ti
Sanskrit jīryati
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Example

tasmā n'ābhikkhaṇaṃ gacche,
na ca gacche cirāciraṃ,
kālena yācaṃ yāceyya,
evaṃ mittā na jīyare.

JA 528 mahābodhi jātakaṃ
jīyati 1.2

pr. grows old; gets old; ages [√jī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning grows old; gets old; ages
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Base √jī + ya > jīya
Construction jīya + ti
Synonym jīrati
Sanskrit jīryati
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Examples

tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ
jīyati 2.1

pr. (+loc) is defeated (in); is conquered (in); suffers loss (in) [√ji + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of jināti, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is defeated (in); is conquered (in); suffers loss (in)
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 īya (conquer)
Base √ji + īya > jīya (pass)
Construction jīya + ti
Synonym parājināti
Sanskrit jīyate
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

sabbaso nāmarūpasmiṃ,
yassa n'atthi mamāyitaṃ,
asatā ca na socati,
sa ve loke na jīyati.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
jīyamāna

prp. growing old; getting old; ageing [√jī + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of jīyati, intrans
Meaning growing old; getting old; ageing
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Base √jī + ya > jīya
Construction jīya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym ajīyamāna
Sanskrit jīryamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Example

tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
jīyi

aor. diminished; decreased; got less; was lost [√jī + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of jīyati, pass, intrans
Meaning diminished; decreased; got less; was lost
Root Family √jī
Root √jī･3 ya (age, decay)
Base √jī + ya > jīya (pass)
Construction jīya + i
Synonym ahāyi
Commentary (SNa) kiṃ jīyitthā'ti yassa hi kiñci manāpaṃ cīvar'ādivatthu jiṇṇaṃ hoti, so socati, tasmā evam'āha.
Sanskrit jṝ
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Example

nandasi, samaṇā'ti? kiṃ laddhā, āvuso'ti? tena hi, samaṇa, socasī'ti? kiṃ jīyittha, āvuso'ti? tena hi, samaṇa, n'eva nandasi na ca socasī'ti? evam'āvuso'ti.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
jīrati

pr. ages; grows old; gets worn out; declines [√jīr + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning ages; grows old; gets worn out; declines
Root Family √jīr
Root √jīr･1 a (grow old, decay)
Base √jīr + a > jīra
Construction jīra + ti
Phonetic Change a > ī (Kacc 505, 482)
Antonym najīrati
Synonym jīyati
Commentary (SNa) jīrantī'ti jaraṃ pāpuṇanti.
Sanskrit jṛṇāti
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

Examples

jīranti ve rājarathā sucittā,
atho sarīram'pi jaraṃ upeti,
satañ'ca dhammo na jaraṃ upeti,
santo have sabbhi pavedayanti.

DHP 151 jarāvaggo

manujassa sadā satīmato,
mattaṃ jānato laddhabhojane,
tanu tassa bhavanti vedanā,
saṇikaṃ jīrati āyupālayan'ti.

jīramāna

prp. becoming old, decayed [√jīr] ✗

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
jīreti

pr. causes to decay or digest [√jīr] ✗

Examples

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

katame satta? pathavīkāyo āpokāyo tejokāyo vāyokāyo sukhe dukkhe jīve sattame, ime sattakāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā.

hirīmatā ca dujjīvaṃ,
niccaṃ sucigavesinā,

suddhājīvena passatā.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu
jīvakambavana

nt. name of a monastery near Rājagaha; lit. Jīvaka's mango grove [jīvaka + ambavana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a monastery near Rājagaha; lit. Jīvaka's mango grove
Construction jīvaka + ambavana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvakassa + ambavana)
Commentary (THIa) jīvak'ambavanan'ti jīvakassa komārabhaccassa ambavanaṃ.
Sanskrit jīvaka + āmravaṇa

Example

jīvak'ambavanaṃ rammaṃ,
gacchantiṃ bhikkhuniṃ subhaṃ,
dhuttako sannivāresi,
tam'enaṃ abravī subhā.

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,
oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati,
atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

aṭṭhakavaggo 6

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu
jīvadanta

masc. tusk of a living animal ✗
jīvana

nt. living, means of subsistence, livelihood [√jīv] ✗

prp. living; going on; surviving [√jīv + a + nta] ✓

Root √jīv･1 a (live)

Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples
