no ce muñceyya candiman'ti.

SN 2.9 candimasuttaṃ

gacchatha, tātā, pabbatapādaṃ pavisitvā jīvantā subhikkhakāle mama santikaṃ āgantu'kāmā āgacchatha, anāgantu'kāmā tattha tatth'eva jīvathā'ti.

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu
jīvamāna

prp. (+loc) living (on); subsisting (on); surviving (off) [√jīv + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of jīvati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning living (on); subsisting (on); surviving (off)
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Base √jīv + a > jīva
Construction jīva + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym jīvanta
Sanskrit jīvamāna
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

evam'eva kho tvaṃ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugat'āpadānesu jīvamāno sugat'ātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṃ maññasi. ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṃ arahantānaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ āsādanā'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ
jīvaloka

masc. world of the living [jīva + loka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning world of the living
Construction jīva + loka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvānaṃ + loka)
Sanskrit jīvaloka

Example

viceyya dānaṃ sugatappasatthaṃ,
ye dakkhiṇeyyā idha jīvaloke,
etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni,
bījāni vuttāni yathā sukhette'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ
jīvasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as alive; regarding (something) as living [jīva + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as alive; regarding (something) as living
Construction jīva + saññī
Commentary (VINa) jīvasaññino'ti sattasaññino.
jīvi

aor. lived, subsisted on [√jīv] ✗
jīvikattha

adj. for the sake of livelihood; to make a living [jīvikā + attha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for the sake of livelihood; to make a living
Construction jīvikā + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvikāya + attha)
Commentary (MNa) jīvikatthā'ti iṇabhay'ādīhi pīḷitā bahi jīvituṃ asakkontā idha jīvikatthikā hutvā.
Sanskrit jīvikā + artha

Example

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
jīvikasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 91 (ITI 91) ✗
jīvikaṃ kappeti

idiom. makes a living; earns a living ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pr
Meaning makes a living; earns a living

Examples

yam'pi bhikkhave tathāgato purimaṃ jātiṃ purimaṃ bhavaṃ purimaṃ niketaṃ pubbe manussabhūto samāno micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappesi

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, kulaputto yena sippaṭṭhānena jīvikaṃ kappeti, yadi muddāya yadi gaṇanāya yadi saṅkhānena yadi kasiyā yadi vaṇijjāya yadi gorakkhena yadi issatthena yadi rājaporisena yadi sipp'aññatarena.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
jīvikaṃ kappenta

idiom. supporting oneself; sustaining oneself ✗
jīvikā

fem. livelihood; way of life [√jīv + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from jīvati
Meaning livelihood; way of life
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Synonym vutti
Sanskrit jīvikā
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

yam'pi bhikkhave tathāgato purimaṃ jātiṃ purimaṃ bhavaṃ purimaṃ niketaṃ pubbe manussabhūto samāno micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappesi

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
jīvita 1

nt. life; existence; lit. lived [√jīv + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of jīvati
Meaning life; existence; lit. lived
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym maraṇa
Synonym nivāsa
Commentary (SNa) jīvitan'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ.
Sanskrit jīvita
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

accayanti ahorattā,
jīvitaṃ uparujjhati,
āyu khīyati maccānaṃ,
kunnadīnaṃ'va odakaṃ.

TH 133 heraññakānittheragāthā

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,
oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati,
atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
jīvita 2

nt. livelihood; lifestyle; way of life; lit. lived [√jīv + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of jīvati
Meaning livelihood; lifestyle; way of life; lit. lived
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit jīvita
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīvitena-upapannaṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

et'ādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi,
nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ,
diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ,
bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
jīvitakkhaya

masc. exhaustion of life; loss of life; death [jīvita + khaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning exhaustion of life; loss of life; death
Construction jīvita + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + khaya)
Sanskrit jīvitakṣaya
jīvitadāna

nt. saving of life ✗
jīvitanikanti

fem. attraction to existence; desire for life [jīvita + nikanti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning attraction to existence; desire for life
Construction jīvita + nikanti
Compound sattamī tappurisa (jīvite + nikanti)
Sanskrit jīvita + nikānti

Example

sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno maraṇasaññāparicitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharato jīvitanikantiyā cittaṃ anusandahati appaṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā, abhāvitā me maraṇasaññā

AN 7.49 dutiyasaññāsuttaṃ
jīvitantarāya

masc. (+gen) danger to the life (of); fatal accident (for) [jīvita + antarāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning danger to the life (of); fatal accident (for)
Construction jīvita + antarāya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (jīvitassa + antarāya)
Sanskrit jīvita + antarāya

Example

dujjānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, bhante, bhagavato vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ, mayhaṃ vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ. desetu me, bhante bhagavā, dhammaṃ, desetu, sugato, dhammaṃ, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
jīvitantika

adj. ending with life; limited to existence [jīvita + antika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ending with life; limited to existence
Construction jīvita + antika
Compound kammadhāraya (jīvita + antika)
Sanskrit jīvita + antika
jīvitapaccayā

ind. dependent on life; due to existence [jīvita + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on life; due to existence
Construction jīvita + paccayā
jīvitaparikkhāra

masc. requisites for life; necessities of existence [jīvita + parikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning requisites for life; necessities of existence
Construction jīvita + parikkhāra
Compound catutthī tappurisa (jīvitassa + parikkhāra)
Commentary (ANa) jīvitaparikkhāresū'ti jīvitasambhāresu.
Sanskrit jīvita + pariṣkāra

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'aṭṭho hoti appakicco subharo susantoso jīvitaparikkhāresu, app'āhāro hoti anodarikattaṃ anuyutto, appamiddho hoti jāgariyaṃ anuyutto

AN 5.96 sutadharasuttaṃ

ye ca kho ime pabbajitena jīvitaparikkhārā samudānetabbā, cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā, te kasirena samudāgacchanti.

MN 17 vanapatthasuttaṃ
jīvitaparikkhārā

masc. requisites of life ✗
jīvitaparicchinna

adj. limited to life; confined to existence [jīvita + paricchinna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning limited to life; confined to existence
Construction jīvita + paricchinna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jīvitena + paricchinna)
Sanskrit jīvita + paricchinna
jīvitapariyantika

adj. limited to life; ending with existence; confined to life [jīvita + pariyantika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning limited to life; ending with existence; confined to life
Construction jīvita + pariyantika
Compound kammadhāraya (jīvita + pariyantika)
Sanskrit jīvita + paryanta

Example

jīvitapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno jīvitapariyantikaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
jīvitapariyādāna

nt. exhaustion of one's life; using up one's lifespan [jīvita + pariyādāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning exhaustion of one's life; using up one's lifespan
Construction jīvita + pariyādāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + pariyādāna)
Sanskrit jīvita + paryādāna

Examples

kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti

DN 1.21 brahmajālasuttaṃ
jīvitapariyosāna

nt. end of life; end of life span [jīvita + pariyosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning end of life; end of life span
Construction jīvita + pariyosāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + pariyosāna)
Sanskrit jīvita + paryavasāna

Example

evaṃ mahāsatto khuddakamakkhikāya pivanamattam'pi lohitaṃ anuppādetvā satta rājāno palāpetvā kaniṭṭhabhātaraṃ apaloketvā kāme pahāya isipabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā abhiññā ca samāpattiyo ca nibbattetvā jīvitapariyosāne brahmalok'ūpago ahosi.

JAa 181 asadisa jātakavaṇṇanā
jīvitabba

ptp. to be lived (by) [√jīv] ✗
jīvitamattano

sandhi. one's own life; one's own existence [jīvitaṃ + attano] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + masc
Meaning one's own life; one's own existence
Construction jīvitaṃ + attano
Commentary (SNa) rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano'ti attano jīvitaṃ rakkhamāno
Sanskrit jīvitam + ātmanaḥ

Example

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
jīvitamada

masc. (+loc) intoxication with life (in) [jīvita + mada] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning intoxication with life (in)
Construction jīvita + mada
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (jīvitena + mada)
Sanskrit jīvita + mada

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ jīvite jīvitamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
jīvitamadamatta

adj. intoxicated with vanity of one's life; proud of one's existence; lit. intoxicated with the intoxication of life [jīvitamada + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intoxicated with vanity of one's life; proud of one's existence; lit. intoxicated with the intoxication of life
Construction jīvitamada + matta
jīvitamaraṇapariyādāna

nt. end of life by death; the very end of life [jīvita + maraṇa + pariyādāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning end of life by death; the very end of life
Construction jīvita + maraṇa + pariyādāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + maraṇapariyādāna)
Commentary (ANa) yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā'ti yāva jīvitassa maraṇena pariyosānā.
Sanskrit jīvita + maraṇa + paryādāna

Example

thāmavā hoti yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā thāmaṃ upadaṃsetā.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
jīvitamāhu

sandhi. they say life [jīvitaṃ + āhu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + perf
Meaning they say life
Construction jīvitaṃ + āhu

Example

na dīgham'āyuṃ labhate dhanena,
na cā'pi vittena jaraṃ vihanti.
appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā,
asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.

TH 251 raṭṭhapālattheragāthā
jīvitamuttamaṃ

sandhi. best life; ultimate existence [jīvitaṃ + uttamaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + adj
Meaning best life; ultimate existence
Construction jīvitaṃ + uttamaṃ
Commentary (SNa) sīlaṃ jīvitamuttaman'ti sīle patiṭṭhitassa jīvitaṃ uttaman'ti dasseti. atha vā ... jīvitamuttaman'ti etasmiṃ sīle ṭhitassa jīvitaṃ nāma uttamaṃ.
Sanskrit jīvitam + uttamam

Example

kammaṃ vijjā ca dhammo ca,
sīlaṃ jīvitam'uttamaṃ,
etena maccā sujjhanti,
na gottena dhanena vā.

SN 1.48 jetavanasuttaṃ
jīvitavutti

fem. livelihood ✗
jīvitasaṅkhaya

masc. end of life; loss of life [jīvita + saṅkhaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning end of life; loss of life
Construction jīvita + saṅkhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + saṅkhaya)
Sanskrit jīvita + saṃkṣaya

Example

atthamhi jātamhi sukhā sahāyā,
tuṭṭhī sukhā yā itarītarena,
puññaṃ sukhaṃ jīvitasaṅkhayamhi,
sabbassa dukkhassa sukhaṃ pahānaṃ.

DHP 331 nāgavaggo
jīvitasaṅkhāra

masc. will to live; intention to live [jīvita + saṅkhāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning will to live; intention to live
Construction jīvita + saṅkhāra
jīvitasambhāra

masc. necessary requirement for life [jīvita + sambhāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning necessary requirement for life
Construction jīvita + sambhāra
jīvitasaṃsaya

masc. danger of life ✗
jīvitahara

adj. taking life [jīvita + hara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking life
Construction jīvita + hara
jīvitahetu

ind. for the sake of one’s life; on account of one’s life [jīvita + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of one’s life; on account of one’s life
Construction jīvita + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitassa + hetu)
Sanskrit jīvita + hetu

Examples

kathañ'ca, visākhe, mātugāmo bhattu manāpaṃ carati? idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattu amanāpasaṅkhātaṃ taṃ jīvitahetu'pi na ajjhācarati. evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo bhattu manāpaṃ carati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yaṃ mayā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ taṃ mama sāvakā jīvitahetu'pi n'ātikkamanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
jīvitaṃ kappeti

idiom. (+instr) leads one's life (with); conducts one's affairs (with); goes about one's business (with) ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr (+instr)
Meaning leads one's life (with); conducts one's affairs (with); goes about one's business (with)
Sanskrit jīvitam + kalpayati

Example

micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, etth'ete akusalā sīlā aparisesā nirujjhanti

MN 78 samaṇamuṇḍikasuttaṃ
jīvitā voropeti

idiom. (+acc) takes life; kills; lit. deprives from life [jīvitā + voropeti] ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr (+acc)
Meaning takes life; kills; lit. deprives from life
Construction jīvitā + voropeti
Commentary (VIN 2.5.7.1) jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti
Sanskrit jīvitāt + vyavaropayati

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya

VIN PAT PA 3 manussaviggahasikkhāpadaṃ

yadā kho, āvuso, tassa purisassa evam'assa, saṃvissattho kho my'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā'ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
jīvitā voropesi

idiom. (+acc) took life; killed; lit. deprived from life [jīvitā + voropesi] ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + aor, aor of jīvitā voropeti (+acc)
Meaning took life; killed; lit. deprived from life
Construction jīvitā + voropesi
Sanskrit jīvitāt + vyavaruh

Example

atha kho bhagavā bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ iminā saṃkhittena ovādena ovaditvā pakkāmi. atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
jīvitāsā

fem. desire for (long) life; expectation of existence [jīvita + āsā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning desire for (long) life; expectation of existence
Construction jīvita + āsā
jīvitindriya 1

nt. life faculty; life force; power of life [jīvita + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning life faculty; life force; power of life
Construction jīvita + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (jīvita + indriya)
Commentary (VINa) tattha duvidhaṃ jīvit'indriyaṃ, rūpajīvit'indriyaṃ, arūpajīvit'indriyañ'ca. tesu arūpajīvit'indriye upakkamo n'atthi, taṃ voropetuṃ na sakkā. rūpajīvit'indriye pana atthi, taṃ voropetuṃ sakkā.
Sanskrit jīvita + indriya

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvit'indriyass'upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
jīvitindriya 2

nt. (abhidhamma) vitality; lit. life faculty [jīvita + indriya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning (abhidhamma) vitality; lit. life faculty
Construction jīvita + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (jīvita + indriya)
Sanskrit jīvita + indriya
jīvitindriyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 48.22 (SN48.22) ✗
jīvitindriyassupaccheda

masc. severing of the life faculty; cutting off existence [jīvitindriyassa + upaccheda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning severing of the life faculty; cutting off existence
Construction jīvitindriyassa + upaccheda
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (jīvitindriyassa + upaccheda)
Sanskrit jīvita + indriya + uccheda, upaccheda (bsk)

Example

yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālaṃkiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo, kaḷevarassa nikkhepo, jīvit'indriyass'upacchedo, idaṃ vuccat'āvuso, maraṇaṃ.

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
jīvitukāma

adj. wishing to live; wanting to stay alive [jīvituṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wishing to live; wanting to stay alive
Construction jīvituṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (jīvituṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit jīvitum + kāma

Examples

vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.

DHP 123 pāpavaggo

atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
jīvituṃ

inf. to live; to remain alive; to survive [√jīv + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of jīvati, intrans
Meaning to live; to remain alive; to survive
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ituṃ
Sanskrit jīvitum
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Examples

pārājiko hotī'ti seyyathā'pi nāma puriso sīsacchinno abhabbo tena sarīrabandhanena jīvituṃ, evam'eva bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo. tena vuccati, pārājiko hotī'ti.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

atha naṃ piṇḍāya caritvā jīvituṃ samatthakāle sā kapālakaṃ hatthe ṭhapetvā.

DHPa 1.5.3 ānandaseṭṭhi vatthu
jīvitenūpapanna

adj. because of lifestyle; due to way of life [jīvitena + upapanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning because of lifestyle; due to way of life
Construction jīvitena + upapanna
Compound alutta tatiyā tappurisa (jīvitena + upapanna)
Commentary (NIDD2) udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannan'ti udāhu anekavividha-atiparamadukkarakārika-lūkhajīvit'ānuyogena upetaṃ samupetaṃ upāgataṃ samupāgataṃ upapannaṃ samupapannaṃ samannāgataṃ muniṃ vadanti kathenti bhaṇanti dīpayanti voharantī'ti, udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ. (SNPa) udāhu ve nānappakārakena lūkhajīvitasaṅkhātena jīviten'ūpapannan'ti
Sanskrit jīvitena + upapanna

Example

santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7
jīvitvā

abs. having lived [√jīv] ✗
jīvī 1

adj. living a lifestyle of; living a life of; leading one's life [√jīv + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from jīvati
Meaning living a lifestyle of; living a life of; leading one's life
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit jīvin
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

kiṃ sū'dha vittaṃ purisassa seṭṭhaṃ,
kiṃ su suciṇṇaṃ sukham'āvahāti,
kiṃ su have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
kathaṃ jīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhaṃ.

SN 1.73 vittasuttaṃ
jīvī 2

adj. who lives; living [√jīv + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from jīvati
Meaning who lives; living
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit jīvin
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī

SN 56.35 sattisatasuttaṃ
juṭṭha

pp. fostered [√jus] ✗
juṇha

adj. bright [√jus + ṇhā + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning bright
Root Family √jus
Root √jus×6 ṇhā (like, please)

Construction juṇhā + a

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, juṇhapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vaḍḍhat'eva vaṇṇena, vaḍḍhati maṇḍalena, vaḍḍhati ābhāya, vaḍḍhati ārohapariṇāhena

APA 27 annasaṃsāvaka therāpadānaṃ

juti + mant

Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Examples

ādānapaṭinissagge,
anupādāya ye ratā,
khīṇ'āsavā jutimanto,
te loke parinibbutā.

DHP 89 paṇḍitavaggo

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

dehi je ambapāli amhākaṃ etaṃ bhattaṃ satasahassenā'ti

VIN 4.6.177 licchavī vatthu
jeguccha 1

nt. repulsion; disgust; distaste; abhorrence [√gup + cha + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from jigucchati, desid
Meaning repulsion; disgust; distaste; abhorrence
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha > jeguccha + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change g > j
i > e
Antonym ajeguccha
Synonym jegucchatā, jegucchitā
Sanskrit jugupsā
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

kuḍḍamūlañ'ca nissāya,
ālopaṃ taṃ abhuñjisaṃ,
bhuñjamāne vā bhutte vā,
jegucchaṃ me na vijjati.

TH 261 mahākassapattheragāthā

i > e

Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Meaning repulsion; disgust; distaste; abhorrence; lit. dislike state

Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha > jeguccha + *a + tā

i > e
Antonym ajegucchatā
Synonym jeguccha
Variant jegucchitā
Sanskrit jugupsā +
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa sahadassanena amanāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, pāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jighacchitānam'pi na bhottukamyatā assa, pag'eva suhitānaṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
jegucchiya

nt. disgusting stuff; something revolting; lit. to be disliked [√gup + cha + *iya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of jigucchati
Meaning disgusting stuff; something revolting; lit. to be disliked
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha > jeguccha + *iya
Derivative kicca (*iya)
Phonetic Change g > j
i > e
Sanskrit jugupsanīya
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gaṇḍo anekavassagaṇiko. tass'assu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni. tato yaṃ kiñci pagghareyya, asuci'y'eva pagghareyya, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ
jegucchī 1

adj. (+inf) who is disgusted (to); recoiling (from); who hates (to); who detests [√gup + cha + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from jigucchati, desid (+inf)
Meaning who is disgusted (to); recoiling (from); who hates (to); who detests

Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha > jeguccha + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change g > j
i > e
Antonym ajegucchī
Synonym jigucchaka
Sanskrit jugupsu
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Examples

atthi khv'esa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya, jegucchī samaṇo gotamo'ti.

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ

jegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā abhinisīdituṃ vā abhinipajjituṃ vā.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
jegucchī 2

adj. scrupulous in morality; who avoids harming any living being; (comm) who is disgusted by evil; lit. disgusted [√gup + cha + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from jigucchati, desid
Meaning scrupulous in morality; who avoids harming any living being; (comm) who is disgusted by evil; lit. disgusted
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 cha (dislike)
Base √gup + gup + sa > jiguccha (desid)
Construction jiguccha > jeguccha + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change g > j
i > e
Commentary (SNa) jegucchī'ti tapena pāpajigucchako.
Notes refers to extreme harmlessness towards other living beings
Sanskrit jugupsu
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

Examples

jegucchī nipako bhikkhu,
cātuyāmasusaṃvuto,
diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhaṃ,
na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, caturaṅgasamannāgataṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritā, tapassī su'daṃ homi paramatapassī, lūkho su'daṃ homi paramalūkho, jegucchī su'daṃ homi paramajegucchī, pavivitto su'daṃ homi paramapavivitto.

Sri Lanka buddha-vassa-sajjhāyanā

so pana vassāno utu sāvaṇapoṭṭhapādamāsā, assayujakattikamāsā sarado, māgasiraphussamāsā hemanto, māghaphaggunamāsā sisiro, cittavesākhamāsā vasanto, jeṭṭha-āsaḷhamāsā gimho utū'ti veditabbo.

jetavanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.48 (SN1.48) ✗

jenta

prp. conquering [√ji] ✗
jentattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 111 (TH111) ✗
jentātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 20 (THI20) ✗
jeyya 1

opt. (+acc) should conquer; could defeat; could overcome [√ji + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of jeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning should conquer; could defeat; could overcome
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 a (conquer)
Construction √ji + eyya
Synonym jine
Sanskrit jayet
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

DHP 103 sahassavaggo
jeyya 2

ptp. should be conquered [√ji] ✗
jevanika

nt. (comm) bladed weapon; lit. related to life [√jīv + ana + *ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from jīvana
Meaning (comm) bladed weapon; lit. related to life
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv > jev + ana + *ika
jīvana + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym salāka
Variant jevaniya
Commentary (ANa) jevanikan'ti ekatodhār'ādises'āvudhaṃ.
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahuṃ āvudhaṃ sannicitaṃ hoti salākañ'c'eva jevanikañ'ca.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
jevaniya

nt. (comm) bladed weapon; lit. related to life [√jīv + ana + *iya] ✓

Grammar nt, from jīvana
Meaning (comm) bladed weapon; lit. related to life
Root Family √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction √jīv > jev + ana + *iya
jīvana + *iya
Derivative taddhita (*iya)
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym salāka
Variant jevanika
Commentary (ANa) jevanikan'ti ekatodhār'ādises'āvudhaṃ.
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahuṃ āvudhaṃ sannicitaṃ hoti salākañ'c'eva jevaniyañ'ca.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
jevanīya

nt. kind of (edged) weapon ✗
jesi

aor. conquered, subdued [√ji] ✗
jessati

fut. (+acc) will conquer; will defeat; will beat [√ji + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of jeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will conquer; will defeat; will beat
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 a (conquer)
Base √ji + a + ssa > jessa (fut)
Construction jessa + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant jayissati
Sanskrit jeṣyati
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

Example

añña'd'atthu sissaṃ musilaṃ ācariya tvam'eva jessasi

VVa 1.3.5 guttila vimānavaṇṇanā
jotaka 1

adj. (gram) clear; explicit; expressing; lit. shining [√jut + *aka] ~

Grammar adj, from jotati
Meaning (gram) clear; explicit; expressing; lit. shining
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *a (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Construction √jut > jot + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym nīta
Sanskrit dyotaka
Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)
jotaka 2

adj. illuminating [√jut] ✗
jotaka 3

adj. who makes clear [√jut] ✗
jotati

pr. shines; twinkles; emits light [√jut + *a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning shines; twinkles; emits light
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *a (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Base √jut + *a > jota
Construction jota + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit dyotate
Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Example

yattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
na tattha sukkā jotanti,
ādicco nappakāsati,
na tattha candimā bhāti,
tamo tattha na vijjati.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
jotana

nt. shining, explanation [√jut] ✗
jotanā

fem. shining, explanation [√jut] ✗
jotanta

prp. shining, becoming bright [√jut] ✗
jotayati

pr. (+acc) makes clear; explains; illuminates; lit. causes to illuminate [√jut + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of jotati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes clear; explains; illuminates; lit. causes to illuminate
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *aya (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Base √jut + *aya > jotaya (caus)
Construction jotaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym akkhāti, ādisati, ārocayati, āroceti, āvikaroti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, jānāpeti, joteti, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pilapati, sandasseti
Sanskrit dyotayati
Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Example

bhāsaye jotaye dhammaṃ,
paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo,
dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ
jotayanta

prp. (+acc) radiating; shining; beaming; glowing [√jut + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of jotayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning radiating; shining; beaming; glowing
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *aya (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Base √jut + *aya > jotaya (caus)
Construction jotaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym obhāsayanta, tapanta, virocamāna, sobhamāna
Sanskrit dyotayat
Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Example

ṭhitako'va mātukucchisambhavena kenaci asucinā amakkhito suddho visado kāsikavatthe nikkhittamaṇiratanaṃ viya jotayanto mātukucchito nikkhami.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
jotayamāna

prp. illuminating, making clear [√jut] ✗

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438
joti 1

Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Example

bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti

DN 19.7 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
joti 2

masc. fire [√jut + *i] ✓

Grammar masc, from jotati
Meaning fire
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *a (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Construction √jut > jot + *i
Derivative kita (*i)

Commentary (VIN 2.5.6.6) joti nāma aggi vuccati.

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu agilāno visibban'āpekkho jotiṃ samādaheyya vā samādahāpeyya vā aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 56 jotisikkhāpadaṃ

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... bilaṅgathālikam'pi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikam'pi karonti, rāhumukham'pi karonti, jotimālikam'pi karonti, hatthapajjotikam'pi karonti, erakavattikam'pi karonti

VIN PAT PC 56 jotisikkhāpadaṃ
joteti

pr. (+acc) makes clear; explains; illuminates; lit. causes to shine [√jut + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of jotati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes clear; explains; illuminates; lit. causes to shine
Root Family √jut
Root √jut･1 *e (shine)
√ In Comps jjut
Base √jut + *e > jote (caus)
Construction jote + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym akkhāti, ādisati, ārocayati, āroceti, āvikaroti, uttānīkaroti, upadisati, jānāpeti, jotayati, dīpeti, deseti, pakāseti, pilapati, sandasseti
Commentary (ANa) jotentī'ti pakāsenti.
Sanskrit dyotayati
Sanskrit Root √dyut 1 (shine)

Example

santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
jotetuṃ

Root Family √div

Construction √div > dyu > jju + u
Derivative kita (u)
Phonetic Change di > dy > jj

Examples

SN 8.2 aratisuttaṃ

na hi pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ,
sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti,
bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.
